story:
Thank you for looking at my pitch. 


I am trying to raise £2000 to kick start my clothing company "Remember The Dead Clothing". 
I aim to use the funds to complete 2 main goals. The first is the production of the garments. this year i will be launching 2 collection's. both consisting of 3 custom designs each in multiple colour's. Later in the year I will be launching a hoodie and also a hat range.

Our current designs are being created by published and award winning tattooist Jake x Conrad  AKA Mr Jake x.  jake is doing this for me for free to help me achive my goal. please see www.mrjakex.com for examples of his work. please be aware that the art work displayed will not be used for clothing. it is to give you a representation of what you can expect from us.  

The second goal I will use the funds to complete is a marketing campaign. I will be using social media as well as more traditional marketing tactics. 
Facebook, Twitter and Instagram will be major tools that i will use to gain a following and promote the brand to our targeted customers. 
i will also be using the Facebook marking App to help expand my brand to people who have liked similar brands. 

..........................................................................................................................................

I have a online shop ready to go and i am also looking at opening a shop on the ASOS market place. on top of this i have arrangements in place to sell via tattoo shops and at tattoo conventions, below is the link for our online shop
http://rememberthedead.bigcartel.com/
I am using a company called Visible Art to print the garments. to see more of there work please follow the link below 
http://www.visibleart.co.uk/

story:
KOS Background:

Represents: Knock Over S!  We want to knock over the old ways!


We love skiing, but we spill too much cash on goggles every year! Why we always have to buy another goggle just because of lightly scratched-up lens, faded frames or dirty marks after ski? Why we always cannot find the colors we want? 

Hey! I want something different!   I want something cool! 


Now, we are having a Goggle Revolution!


We know Taiwan is a goggle-manufacturing center so we go there to develop our new goggle this summer for revolutionizing the scene! KOS Mixski goggle is a dawning concept, where customers simply buy 1 pair of goggle to enjoy the use of multiples. When you have KOS Mixski, you do not need another!


DIY: Customers can have fun snapping on different parts of their own goggles. You can choose only the frame, or the lens, or just the straps to do mix and match yourself! It is not only fun but can substantially save costs. It is simple and environmental too. You do not need to discard your goggle and buy a new one every winter!  If you decide your straps are getting worn, you can simply purchase new straps and replace the old one yourself.  Easy!



How does it works?

Buy 1 pair of KOS Mixski goggle, and then you can buy the parts -- just frame or just len or just strap. They are all interchangeable! You do not have to buy a new entire pair of goggle anymore in the future. Len has been scratched, then I buy the Len only to replace my original, or I can definitely buy 2 frames for my holiday in the ski resort, changing it each day by myself.



The color of your goggles don't match your outfit? Never again!

You can definitely pick and choose any color you wishes for your goggle frame, lens and straps according to our color numbers (We have more than 7 color groups with one secret group for your choice! You can only find the color of secret group after order placed!) 

Our team has put a lot of efforts into colors, printings and patterns design. We want something special comparing with the goggles now you see in the stores, to make you always appear cool and unique!


BLACK GROUP





RED GROUP






NEON GREEN GROUP




NEON PINK GROUP



NEON ORANGE GROUP






WHITE GROUP





DARK BLUE GROUP





Our Frame is made of polyurethanes (PU) which is really soft material. It comes with triple layers soft face foam which make you feel comfortable.


It is also designed to put over your optical frames. Even you wear the prescription glasses, no need to put it off when skiing!


We, KOS, always pursue to the superior lens quality, not just the basic function of UV400. Our provided lens are poly-carbonate with Double Inner Len which is made in Italy with very good anti-fog effect. 


Our straps are made with 3 waves of durable silicone material that can be anti-slip, stretched and pulled without breaking! 


With the very nice and special design, our straps look so cool!


This winter, with KOS MIXSKI Goggles, you will always impress!

No more restricts of limited frames, lens and straps! 



Let's try our goggles!

story:
Certificate of Compliance / Approved Tests

 

 

Hi there! We are the P&J Company the makers of ALL 7 Wearable Fan.

Since 2012, P&J has been developing various ideas, patents, and technology transfers, and has been carrying out both trade and product sourcing. The ALL7 is an innovative product that has gone through various trials and errors for two years and we are always looking to find better ways to benefit the users.

The name ALL7 was made as it is our companies 7th product which we developed. In addition, ALL7 was created combining ALL and 7 in that it can be used as a portable fan 24/7 anytime and anyplace.

 

Q: Doesn’t it hurt your shoulder if you wear it for a long period of time?

A: Based on our experiment, It doesn’t hurt the shoulder even after wearing for a long time because the product is very light and the necklace part is very soft.

 

Q: Is it possible to charge the product while wearing it?

A: Yes, however, we suggest you use the product after fully charged because the charging terminal locates at the inside of the main part, and it might be uncomfortable while using it

 

Q: How do you clean the product?

A: Since ALL7 is the portable fan without a propeller, you don’t need to clean the inside separately. For the outside of the necklace part, you can softly wipe it with a light wet tissue or a towel. However, you must use a dry towel to clean the front main body.

 

Q: How do you charge the product?

A: You can use either our enclosed USB cable or any 5-pin USB cable to charge.

 

Q: How long does it last?

A: You can use it from 3 to 6 hours, depending on the wind level before having to charge.

 

Regards to Shipping 

Due to the Outbreak shipping prices may vary throughout the funding.

story:
Create Your Amazing Infographic. 

Piktochart is a young startup based in Malaysia, and we want to help people make their information beautiful. The format that we chose for this is infographic because they are concise, usually in one page and the readers understand information in about 1 minute. They stand out from the rest of the visual presentations and give you an edge when you have great numbers to present to a web audience.

Create Using 3 Simple Steps. In 30 minutes.

Our editor has been designed to be really simple. It has all the basic features you need in order to create a Piktochart. After you sign in, (1) Select a theme (2) Customize it with colors and fonts (3) Drag and drop! 

Customer testimonial: "fantastic for quick infographics, totally 'drag and drop'. The new Prezi for sure!"

 

Select 1 out of 40+ Professionally Designed Themes (and growing).

We pride ourselves in the creation of the themes because we work with real companies/people with real data and information and throw the information back and forth to achieve the best design and layout for you. 

 

 

Customize Colors and Fonts within 1 Click.

We select the best fonts from Google Web Fonts that we love. We make it easy for you to switch between colors, with just one click of the mouse. And the fun just began!

 

Drag and Drop.

The entire editor works with a drag and drop. If you wanted a new shape, chart, upload your own image, you have to drag and drop everything into the canvas. It's intuitive and fun!

Where are we now? (We Need Your Help!)

The current Piktochart is Version 0.5, 2 developers spent 6 months refining the prototype. It works fine for most infographics and presentations, but what about making it cooler - e.g. export it into slide-based-compatible formats? What about adding animation? Expand the library of icons? Adding lots more themes? We are sure we can hear more creative ideas from you.

 

Let's build Piktochart together. 

We are raising $30,000 because we would like to keep developing the app and making a cooler Piktochart version 2.0 a reality. The main building blocks (we estimated the time and then the costs required):

  • Build an interactive version
  • Add another 10 themes
  • Launch a print-friendly version

 

Spread the word and tell us what you want to see in Version 1.0 - 2.0. The estimated release timeline for Version 2.0 is September 2012.

A recap of Rewarding Perks

$5 - Personal thank you


$10 - 1 month Pro subscription to Piktochart (worth $15)

$50 - 5 months Pro subscription to Piktochart (worth $90)

$100 - Wall sized infographic poster sent to your doorstep, created by YOU

$400 Friend - 1 Piktochart designed and customized specially for you

$500 BFF - Forever free account (whatever Piktochart comes up with - any new releases, themes, features) - you get it for free. 

 

FAQ

1. What is the quality of the wall-sized infographic poster?

Printing material - Canvas quality. Estimated size around 3 ft width in width and 5 ft in length. We will wrap it up securely and send it over to your delivery address (anywhere reachable by the postal system in the world) within 3 weeks of receiving your design on Piktochart.

2. What do I get with customized Piktochart perk ($497 VIP Friends)?

Within 2-3 days turn around time, we will churn out an impressive looking Piktochart that you can use anywhere (high resolution for print or lower resolution for web publishing purposes).

We require the information/story-line and design brief to come from you. It is also limited to 3 revisions so we will appreciate your help confirming as much information as possible. [OPTIONAL] Once the design is done, we will put it up on Piktochart.com as an exclusive theme that only you can use/name!

3. Where can I go and get more information about Piktochart?

Email us, call us, talk to us on Facebook/Twitter. More importantly, check out the app and we look forward to talk to all of you in one way or another.

story:
Byron Lars Beauty Mark is a designer collection of specialty-driven women's clothing, with a focus on fit and meticulous garment construction.  Our clothes have been rendered a fashion must-have among celebrities Taylor Swift, Angela Bassett, Kim Kardashian and First Lady Michelle Obama to name a few.  The truly exciting development is what we expect to be a seismic shift in the perception of plus size, as we launch an offering of our hallmark styles from size 0 all the way up to size 22, each with a single unifying message of "exclusive" inclusion.  
  Statistics estimate that 65 to 68% of women in the US are considered plus size, and she's spending 17.5 billion dollars a year on apparel alone but, as these articles from CNBC's, Bloomberg's and Business Insider's online news platforms suggest, this total would be significantly higher if she were being given the variety and caliber of product to warrant it.  

 

Our approach to reaching her is about NOT singling her out but instead, writing her into the body positive Byron Lars Beauty Mark story of "exclusive" inclusion.  This is not a plus conversation...it's a WOMAN'S conversation, so our label is the same, our styling is the same, and our superior quality is the same from size 0  to 22, because it's the same woman we're dressing!      

On August 30th, 2016, Byron Lars will present this inclusive collection on a range of diverse models in all shapes and sizes. The event will be attended by celebrities of film, television and stage along with some of the most popular fashion influencers of today.
   NOVA, a DreamWorks spinoff company, is creating digital content for the event, which will encapsulate our entire message.  Their 3D design team is digitizing an array of different types and sizes of women who will all be looking fabulous dressed in a single Byron Lars Beauty Mark dress style.

 

Partner with us!

Byron Lars is opening up sponsorship and patron opportunities to the public for this groundbreaking presentation for the first time. Guarantee your invitation, gift bag and face time with one of fashion's most talented designers. Sip cocktails and nibbles with leading celebrities.

  • We have some great brands and corporate sponsors already, but we wanted a portion of this event to be sponsored with real fans and customers like you!  We would love the last $3000 of the event production to be supported by the fashion lovers who want to be a part of the event. 
  • Come celebrate with us in person, take home gift bags, be photographed with Byron and other celebrities on the red carpet by professional photographers. If you are an independent business, you can have your business logo on marketing for the show. 

The Impact

You will be supporting a great designer and the mission of offering impeccably made fashion that fits women of all shapes and sizes. You will be supporting the hard work of his dedicated team. You will be sending the message that women of all sizes and designers of color deserve to be recognized and celebrated.

Challenges

When some fans took the brand to task for not offering the collection to fuller figures, the designer took it to heart. He has spent the last few months reviewing his designs and fitting them on a range of full figured models to make his the sexiest collection available to everyone.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't join us at the event, help us get the word out! Check out our Instagram, Twitter and Facebook feeds to see what our new collections look like. If you love them as much as we do, tell us and tell everyone you know!

story:
The Story: Short Version

Basically, Pursuit was on Kickstarter in October 2015. The campaign succeeded, but since then, the business has failed. 

Now I owe a lot of money ($12,000) to my manufacturer. So I'm selling as much inventory as possible at incredibly low prices (I bought the watches from my manufacturer for over $40/pc) in an effort to recoup some of my costs and help pay off my debt.

Essentially it's a win-win: you get an awesome watch for dirt cheap, I don't have to start selling drugs to pay off my debt.

If you want to know more about the watches, check out the original Kickstarter or, check out our website.

 

The Story: Real Talk

 

Okay, let’s get caught up. It took me a long time to admit it, but Pursuit is a failure.

A lot of you probably saw the Kickstarter campaign and know that I had this idea back in January 2015 that I wanted to start up a watch company. I wanted the company to be centered on the idea of inspiring people to chase after their passions and to live boldly. So with that idea, I jumped right into it, and in October of last year I ran a campaign on Kickstarter that raised $20,000.

The reality of that story was that my campaign didn’t actually raise $20,000. That was my first mistake. I had put in a lot of hard work, lots of late nights, and a lot of hours to get the campaign to where it was. Towards the end of the campaign we were sitting at about $15,000 and I decided that I wasn’t ready to see the project die given how far I’d already come. So with that, I self-funded the last $5,000 to bring us to our goal.

Looking back, I can see now that obviously I should have listened to the market and accepted that given where the campaign was at, it needed to be scrapped, or worked on, or pretty much anything but self-funded.

*Lesson #1: Listen to the market

My next poor decision was looking at the Kickstarter campaign and thinking:

  “Wow! $15,000 in sales in the first month! I couldn’t imagine not doing at least $3-5K in sales/month moving forward!”

Obviously that assumption was pretty crazy given the amount of momentum that was generated just by friends and family. Again, hindsight is 20/20. Nevertheless, based on that assumption I placed a second order for another 500 watches (the minimum order quantity) out of fear of going out of inventory. I figured I only had enough watches to last me another couple of months, and the lead-time for an order of watches was about a 4-month period. With that, another $17,000 was spent.

*Lesson #2: Don’t get ahead of yourself. Be realistic when necessary.

So for the next couple months I continued to work on building a website, marketing my site, and just generally figuring out how to make things work. After about 5 months with few more sales coming in, the money ran out and with that; tired, and defeated, I gave up. I didn’t tell myself or anyone else around me that I was giving up on it though. No, I told myself that I was simply taking a break. To date, this has been the most significant, and by far the most public failure of my entire life. In all honesty, I just did not want to admit that to myself. I didn’t want to call it what it was and accept that I had failed. More than anything, it killed me to think that all of my friends and family would know that it was a failure. To be honest, it really fucking sucked that whenever I hadn’t seen someone in a while, one of the first things that would come up would be “Hey! How’s Pursuit going?!”. So I lied. I’d say it was all going well, when really it was all falling down and I just didn’t have it in me to admit that.

I wish I could say that the impact of lying to myself ended there, but unfortunately that wouldn’t be the truth. All this time that I’d been lying to myself and refusing to admit my failure, I’d been telling my manufacturer that I needed more time. I’d tell him that the sales were slow, and that I needed a couple more months before I’d have the money.

I currently owe my manufacturer $12,000 USD that I don’t have. Which is why I’ve turned back to crowd funding and ultimately, why I need you.

Admitting to myself that I had failed was what I needed to do in order to start actually dealing with the impact of my failure.

*Lesson #3: Be honest with yourself.

The reality is that everyone fails. Failure is as much a part of life as success and honestly, it’s a really great lesson to learn, especially with the message behind Pursuit. It’s important for people to know that “follow your passions” is not some magical solution where life is always sunshine and rainbows. What it means to pursue your passions is that you’re going to fall flat on your face and fail a lot of the time. You’re going to have your ups and your downs just like anyone else will. The thing with that though is that to have tried and failed is a million times better than to never have tried at all. If you never pursue your passions – if you decide to just “play it safe” – you’re not going to have the great, big, massive failures. You just won’t. If you play it safe you really can avoid a lot of the truly massive failures. The other side of that is that you’re never going to have those great, big, huge wins in your life either. When you’re not playing full out in life you simply aren’t going to have any truly massive wins. Your life will just be… ordinary. For some people that might be okay, but that’s not what Pursuit is about. Pursuit is about extraordinary. I am about extraordinary. With the people that I coach, that’s what I want. With the people I’m able to inspire with Pursuit, that’s my goal. To me life is an opportunity, and you only get one shot at it. Why not make it the greatest experience that you could possibly make it? So that’s what I wanted to do with Pursuit and that’s what I still want to do with my life.

What I’ve learned is that Pursuit, as a brand, as a watch company, is not the vehicle through which I’m going to do that, and that’s okay. To me, it’s not about to vehicle; it’s about the outcome. I don’t care how I’m going to do it; I’m going to do it. I’m committed to having an extraordinary life and I’m committed to helping and inspiring others to do the same. I’m going to fall along that path a whole lot more times between now and the day I die, but I’m okay with that. Failure is all just a part of it. That’s something that I really thought I knew. Turns out that it took me losing a whole lot of money before I truly figured that out. About $70,000 all in.

*Lesson #4: Failure is not the end. It’s just a part of life.

By far the best thing about failure is that you can learn from it. Through failing I’ve learned everything I just poured into this article and I wouldn’t want my money back on any of it.

So that brings us to what this campaign is all about. Right now, I’ve got a job to do. I need to deal with the impact of my failure, and to do so, I need to come up with $12,000 USD as soon as possible. Lucky for you, out of every failure comes an opportunity. One opportunity that has come from this failure is watches. Lots and lots of watches that need to go! So this is my last “Hoorah!” with Pursuit. I’ll be straight up with you, I’m paying my manufacturer $42/pc for these watches, so I’m taking a loss (which I’m used to at this point) and selling them to you for $35. Same great watch, but with the “I need to get myself out of this crushing debt” discount!

I’ve gone to wholesalers, retailers, friends, family, co-workers, and just about anyone else who’ll listen trying to sell these watches and I need your help to go the last couple steps. So whether you’ve got a watch, love it, and want another; or you don’t have one, and want one; this is a pretty great opportunity to treat yourself.

I may have some work to do trying to figure out the e-commerce side of things and trying to work out how to market and sell online, but at the very least I’m more confident than ever that I’ve got a great product. If you want to check out reviews you can see them here.

Lastly, I want to take one final opportunity here to really say thanks. I don’t know that I’ll ever really be able to thank all of you enough for what you did for me in the first campaign, or the support that you’ve given me all throughout this journey. The truth is I honestly wouldn’t have had any of these experiences, or any of these opportunities to learn and to grow if it hadn’t been for each and every one of you guys who have helped me out along the way. Though it may not look like it right now, every one of you has helped me to pursue my passions and make some of my dreams a reality, so for that, from the bottom of my heart, I thank you. I wish all of you the best in success and happiness.

Until next time,

James

 

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

We Need: Money to get out of debt!

You Get: Awesome watches for just $35 each

    Risks & Challenges

    That's one big advantage here: as soon as the campaign ends, we'll send out the survey to choose colours. As we get your answers, orders will be shipped. Same day.

    We already have 261 watches still sitting in inventory at our warehouse from the first order. The warehouse is able to ship out 1,000's of units in a single day so there's no concerns there.

     

     

     

      Other Ways You Can Help

      Share. Let people know about this awesome deal!

      Facebook, Instagram, Snapchat! Share, Share, Share!!
story_txt:
The Story: Short Version
Basically, Pursuit was on Kickstarter in October 2015. The campaign succeeded, but since then, the business has failed. 
Now I owe a lot of money ($12,000) to my manufacturer. So I'm selling as much inventory as possible at incredibly low prices (I bought the watches from my manufacturer for over $40/pc) in an effort to recoup some of my costs and help pay off my debt.
Essentially it's a win-win: you get an awesome watch for dirt cheap, I don't have to start selling drugs to pay off my debt.
If you want to know more about the watches, check out the original Kickstarter or, check out our website.
 
The Story: Real Talk
 
Okay, let’s get caught up. It took me a long time to admit it, but Pursuit is a failure.
A lot of you probably saw the Kickstarter campaign and know that I had this idea back in January 2015 that I wanted to start up a watch company. I wanted the company to be centered on the idea of inspiring people to chase after their passions and to live boldly. So with that idea, I jumped right into it, and in October of last year I ran a campaign on Kickstarter that raised $20,000.
The reality of that story was that my campaign didn’t actually raise $20,000. That was my first mistake. I had put in a lot of hard work, lots of late nights, and a lot of hours to get the campaign to where it was. Towards the end of the campaign we were sitting at about $15,000 and I decided that I wasn’t ready to see the project die given how far I’d already come. So with that, I self-funded the last $5,000 to bring us to our goal.
Looking back, I can see now that obviously I should have listened to the market and accepted that given where the campaign was at, it needed to be scrapped, or worked on, or pretty much anything but self-funded.
*Lesson #1: Listen to the market
My next poor decision was looking at the Kickstarter campaign and thinking:
  “Wow! $15,000 in sales in the first month! I couldn’t imagine not doing at least $3-5K in sales/month moving forward!”
Obviously that assumption was pretty crazy given the amount of momentum that was generated just by friends and family. Again, hindsight is 20/20. Nevertheless, based on that assumption I placed a second order for another 500 watches (the minimum order quantity) out of fear of going out of inventory. I figured I only had enough watches to last me another couple of months, and the lead-time for an order of watches was about a 4-month period. With that, another $17,000 was spent.
*Lesson #2: Don’t get ahead of yourself. Be realistic when necessary.
So for the next couple months I continued to work on building a website, marketing my site, and just generally figuring out how to make things work. After about 5 months with few more sales coming in, the money ran out and with that; tired, and defeated, I gave up. I didn’t tell myself or anyone else around me that I was giving up on it though. No, I told myself that I was simply taking a break. To date, this has been the most significant, and by far the most public failure of my entire life. In all honesty, I just did not want to admit that to myself. I didn’t want to call it what it was and accept that I had failed. More than anything, it killed me to think that all of my friends and family would know that it was a failure. To be honest, it really fucking sucked that whenever I hadn’t seen someone in a while, one of the first things that would come up would be “Hey! How’s Pursuit going?!”. So I lied. I’d say it was all going well, when really it was all falling down and I just didn’t have it in me to admit that.
I wish I could say that the impact of lying to myself ended there, but unfortunately that wouldn’t be the truth. All this time that I’d been lying to myself and refusing to admit my failure, I’d been telling my manufacturer that I needed more time. I’d tell him that the sales were slow, and that I needed a couple more months before I’d have the money.
I currently owe my manufacturer $12,000 USD that I don’t have. Which is why I’ve turned back to crowd funding and ultimately, why I need you.
Admitting to myself that I had failed was what I needed to do in order to start actually dealing with the impact of my failure.
*Lesson #3: Be honest with yourself.
The reality is that everyone fails. Failure is as much a part of life as success and honestly, it’s a really great lesson to learn, especially with the message behind Pursuit. It’s important for people to know that “follow your passions” is not some magical solution where life is always sunshine and rainbows. What it means to pursue your passions is that you’re going to fall flat on your face and fail a lot of the time. You’re going to have your ups and your downs just like anyone else will. The thing with that though is that to have tried and failed is a million times better than to never have tried at all. If you never pursue your passions – if you decide to just “play it safe” – you’re not going to have the great, big, massive failures. You just won’t. If you play it safe you really can avoid a lot of the truly massive failures. The other side of that is that you’re never going to have those great, big, huge wins in your life either. When you’re not playing full out in life you simply aren’t going to have any truly massive wins. Your life will just be… ordinary. For some people that might be okay, but that’s not what Pursuit is about. Pursuit is about extraordinary. I am about extraordinary. With the people that I coach, that’s what I want. With the people I’m able to inspire with Pursuit, that’s my goal. To me life is an opportunity, and you only get one shot at it. Why not make it the greatest experience that you could possibly make it? So that’s what I wanted to do with Pursuit and that’s what I still want to do with my life.
What I’ve learned is that Pursuit, as a brand, as a watch company, is not the vehicle through which I’m going to do that, and that’s okay. To me, it’s not about to vehicle; it’s about the outcome. I don’t care how I’m going to do it; I’m going to do it. I’m committed to having an extraordinary life and I’m committed to helping and inspiring others to do the same. I’m going to fall along that path a whole lot more times between now and the day I die, but I’m okay with that. Failure is all just a part of it. That’s something that I really thought I knew. Turns out that it took me losing a whole lot of money before I truly figured that out. About $70,000 all in.
*Lesson #4: Failure is not the end. It’s just a part of life.
By far the best thing about failure is that you can learn from it. Through failing I’ve learned everything I just poured into this article and I wouldn’t want my money back on any of it.
So that brings us to what this campaign is all about. Right now, I’ve got a job to do. I need to deal with the impact of my failure, and to do so, I need to come up with $12,000 USD as soon as possible. Lucky for you, out of every failure comes an opportunity. One opportunity that has come from this failure is watches. Lots and lots of watches that need to go! So this is my last “Hoorah!” with Pursuit. I’ll be straight up with you, I’m paying my manufacturer $42/pc for these watches, so I’m taking a loss (which I’m used to at this point) and selling them to you for $35. Same great watch, but with the “I need to get myself out of this crushing debt” discount!
I’ve gone to wholesalers, retailers, friends, family, co-workers, and just about anyone else who’ll listen trying to sell these watches and I need your help to go the last couple steps. So whether you’ve got a watch, love it, and want another; or you don’t have one, and want one; this is a pretty great opportunity to treat yourself.
I may have some work to do trying to figure out the e-commerce side of things and trying to work out how to market and sell online, but at the very least I’m more confident than ever that I’ve got a great product. If you want to check out reviews you can see them here.
Lastly, I want to take one final opportunity here to really say thanks. I don’t know that I’ll ever really be able to thank all of you enough for what you did for me in the first campaign, or the support that you’ve given me all throughout this journey. The truth is I honestly wouldn’t have had any of these experiences, or any of these opportunities to learn and to grow if it hadn’t been for each and every one of you guys who have helped me out along the way. Though it may not look like it right now, every one of you has helped me to pursue my passions and make some of my dreams a reality, so for that, from the bottom of my heart, I thank you. I wish all of you the best in success and happiness.
Until next time,
James

We Need: Money to get out of debt!
You Get: Awesome watches for just $35 each

Risks & Challenges

We already have 261 watches still sitting in inventory at our warehouse from the first order. The warehouse is able to ship out 1,000's of units in a single day so there's no concerns there.

story:
I have studied many spinning tops designs and I decided to go way back to basics to a design dating to year 3000 B.C. Our design is inspired from terra cotta ceramic spinners that were found at Troy.

I have chosen this design due to its spinning abilities and it's mesmerizing beauty. I believe it is the perfect balance between performance and beauty. Similar designs have been portrayed on popular culture, such as the blockbuster movie "Inception".

Designed and 3d prototyped in the Connex 500. The Connex 500 is a half a million dollar 3d printer made for precision Prototyping, with an accuracy of 16 microns (5 times smaller than a human hair) we have been able to come up with a spinning top that is a perfect balance of weight and symmetry. 

Our Tops are CNC Machined from 1 solid piece of high-grade metal rod for precision and quality.



Precision, durability and luxury is what will set forever spin apart from other spinning tops.

Every spinning top, is manually checked with the latest technology to ensure that only perfectly balanced spinning tops will get a serial number, and be allowed to carry the Foreverspin seal. 


We have some amazing rewards that you get for backing this project. I hope they last you a lifetime.

story:
Our Story 

My name is Nick Lynch, and I am a cancer survivor. When I was 3 years old I was diagnosed with a stage 3 Wilms Tumor in my kidney. While in the hospital, the only thing that would make me happy was dinosaurs; Dinosaur toys, shirts, movies, candy, really anything with a dinosaur. When I went into surgery, my mom handed out red dinosaur stickers for everyone to wear as a sign of support. She had everyone in the hospital wearing one. It is that symbol of solidarity and support that has inspired me to create The Dino Club. I have always wanted to give back to people going through cancer, especially kids, and now it is finally my chance. 

About The Dino Club 

We will be following the Toms model of giving back - for every t-shirt sold, we will give a t-shirt to a child fighting cancer. The t-shirts that we will be giving back are specially designed to allow them to be worn comfortably while connected to IV's, during blood tests & chemotherapy sessions, and all of the other unpleasant parts of being sick. Let's replace those cold hospital gowns with something that unites all of us - Dinos! We will also be supporting and proving funds to the Child Life departments at children’s hospitals. These are vital departments that help provide fun activities for the children while they are in the hospital. Lastly, we will also be 100% transparent. On our blog, we will tell you how many t-shirts we sold, how many t-shirts we donated, how much money we donated and where, and consistently include our customers in the giving decisions. You can learn more about us at thedinoclub.com. 

The Designs 

We have several different kinds and colors of dinosaurs: 

  • Blue Brontosaurus 
  • Red Triceratops 
  • Purple Stegosaurus 
  • Green T-Rex 
  • Orange Pterodactyl 

We have created patches of all of these dinosaurs and sewn them on amazing clothing. You will find t-shirts (V-neck, crew neck, & long sleeve), hoodies, and women’s tanks. We want these t-shirts to be the coolest, most comfortable t-shirts you own! 

We also have amazing hats, stickers and bracelets to spread the dino message even easier.  

If you are a doctor or nurse, we will mail you a patch for free for your scrubs! Just email us at info@thedinoclub.com to let us know which hospital, which department you work in, and an address to mail the patch to. 

Funding 

All funding from this campaign will be used to put this project into production and get everything printed and into your hands. Any extra will go towards inventory for the site so we can continue to produce these great products. 

How the funding breaks down:  

  • IndieGoGo takes a 4% Fee   
  • Payment processor takes a 3-5% Fee  
  • Rest of the funding will be used for production of goods to get these items to you and to have stock for our website. 

Over and Above Goals 

We have several ideas on what we would like to do if we exceed our goals. We could introduce a new dinosaur, build a dino game iPhone app, add new dino clothing like socks and sunglasses, or we could give the money to a hospital. We will definitely seek your opinions, as we get closer to reaching our goal! 

The Rewards 

Obviously, the main point of the rewards is to get the dino’s in your hands! So while there are various reward levels, and all levels will have a great combination of available dino gear. 

Once the campaign has ended, we will be reaching out to all of our supports to get your t-shirt preferences (size, color, style, etc.).

Apparel images here are mockups. Actual products may vary from the mockups in color tone, graphic size/positioning, etc. number of inks used in the graphic, available colors, and brand of the apparel are all things that may change by the time the shirts go into production. - Shipping estimate is just that - an estimate. If I receive more orders than anticipated by an extreme margin, it may delay shipment of the rewards. 

Links 

  • The Dino Club site: thedinoclub.com (after the IndieGoGo project remaining products will be sold here) 
  •  The Dino Club Twitter: @thedinoclub 
  • The Dino Club Facebook: facebook.com/itsthedinoclub 

The Hospitals 

We will be working with Oakland Children’s hospital initially and we are hoping to add Los Angeles, San Diego and UNMH very soon! 

Special Thanks 

A special thanks to my Mom, Dad, sister, Noelle for designing these amazing shirts, and to Joslin for being my support and strength!

story:
WHAT IS SMART DOT?

The Smart Dot is a stylish two-in-one: a high quality and durable dust cover/plug and a precise mini stylus. Use it for your phone, tablet, or other smart device! Universal for anything with a 3.5 millimeter jack. 

It's lightweight and streamlined: easy access for the modern person on the go. Unnoticeable and sleek, it is ready when you are! No worries about looking for your stylus as it's right there, protecting your 3.5 jack from dust and other unwanted microscopic specks of dirt.

Besides adding a subtle touch of minimal personalization via a tiny pop of silver and black to your smart device, our Smart Dot makes it easier to play games, draw and trace, leaving your beloved smart device with significantly less fingerprint and oil print.

 The Smart Dot comes in two bold classic monochrome colors in a slight metallic finish:
  • Silver
  • Onyx (black)

Our dual dust cover/plug and mini stylus are made of durable and high quality plastic and comes in three cool colors. No more unnecessary or unwanted fingerprints or dust and dirt in your 3.5 mm jack!

USAGE

Besides being a handy dust plug/cover, use Smart Dot for almost every function for your smart device!

Use Smart Dot to type and text!

Smart Dot for drawing and sketching

Perfect for games!

BACKSTORY

We wanted to create something versatile and convenient, as more often than not, we're almost always out of the house and rely heavily on our smart devices for news, meetings, fun, etc. We would forget to bring our stylus with us, or it'd keep getting lost in our bag and we'd spent quite a few minutes trying to furiously dig it out. 

One day, we looked at a pair of earbuds and our stylus... and a lightbulb went off in our heads. What if we combined the two? And so after numerous product sketches and prototypes, our Smart Dot was born!

For more information, please visit our official website here: http://smartdotshop.com

For promotional photos, please visit our Dropbox here: https://www.dropbox.com/sh/hqlxcciyq3fbe3t/3SqXzXyfha

story:
SCROLL DOWN FOR ENGLISH

Lieve kijkers, familie, vrienden en supporters,

Mijn naam is EVAN, EVAN menswear. 

Ik krijg de geweldige kans mijn eerste collectie te showen op Fashion Lab tijdens de Mercedes-Benz FashionWeek Amsterdam van 23-27 januari 2014. Maar ik kan het niet alleen en heb jullie financiële hulp hierbij heel hard nodig. Geld voor o.a. materialen, productie, onkosten modellen, accessoires, artwork, perspromotie, fotoshoots, alles wat komt kijken voor de uiteindelijke presentatie. 

Het wordt beslist een geweldig avontuur, dat je niet wilt missen en ik ook graag met jullie wil delen. Ik wil je daarom met alle liefde vragen of jij degene bent, die mij helpt een prachtige show neer te zetten. Een show, die met jouw hulp de groots mogelijke kans van slagen krijgt. Samen kunnen wij het waarmaken en natuurlijk zijn er ook rewards, die je support nog leuker maken. Een exclusieve EVAN menswear beanie, personal (de)signed t-shirt, front-row kaartjes voor de show, een etentje voor 2 of als je voor de hoofdprijs wilt gaan, persoonlijk stylingadvies en een op maat gemaakte EVAN menswear overjas, het kan allemaal van jou zijn! Hiernaast zie je om welke bedragen het gaat en welke rewards je daarmee ontvangt. 

Dit is pas het begin van een prachtig verhaal. Ooit komt er een dag, dat ik de wereld iets terug kan geven en ik een inspiratie kan zijn voor alle jonge dromers, die niet weten welke richting zij op moeten. Een motivatie voor jonge creatieve mensen, die niet alle kansen krijgen. Ja, ooit komt er een dag, dat mijn passie en liefde, de wereld elkaar zullen raken.

With love,
EVAN menswear
by Evaa Kuik

Geld doneren is heel eenvoudig!
* klik op 'contribute now' rechts boven in het scherm
* vul het bedrag in dat je wilt doneren
* kies je perk (reward) 
* vul de rest in en ik zorg voor levering van je reward
Onwijs bedankt voor je  support!

Heb je geen creditcard of PayPal, maar wil je graag doneren, mail mij. Ik stuur je andere betaalopties toe en zorg, dat het geld in mijn campagne komt. Ook voor verdere info, ben ik bereikbaar op info@evan-menswear.com.

Andere manieren om te helpen!
* vertel je vrienden, familie en collega's over mijn campagne
* share mijn campagne op Facebook 

Dear viewers, family, friends and supporters,

My name is EVAN, EVAN menswear,

I have the great opportunity to show my first collection at Fashion Lab during Mercedes-Benz FashionWeek Amsterdam from 23-27 January 2014. But I cannot do it alone; your financial help is very much needed. Funds for materials, manufacturing, expenses models, accessories, artwork, press promotion, photoshoots, everything what it takes for the final presentation. 

It will be a great adventure you definitively do not want to miss and I very much like to share with you. I would therefore ask you with all my love if you are the one who helps me to put down a wonderful show. A show that with your help will have the greatest possible chance of success. Together we can make it true and of course there are rewards (perks) that make your support even more fun. An exclusive EVAN menswear beanie, a personal signed t-shirt, front-row tickets to the show, a dinner for 2, or if you want to go for the grand prize, personal styling and a special EVAN menswear item tailor-made, it can all be yours! Here you see what amounts are involved and what rewards you receive thereby.

This is just the beginning of a wonderful story. There comes a day, that I can give something back to the world and I can be an inspiration for all young dreamers who do not know which direction to go. A motivation for young creative people, who do not get any chances. Yes, there will be a day, that my passion and love, the world will touch.

With love,
EVAN menswear
by Evaa Kuik

Donating is very easy:
* click 'contribute now' on the upper right
* fill in the amount you want to donate
* choose your perk (reward) 
* I'll handle it from there and I will make sure you get your chosen reward
Thank you all! I could not do it without you.

If you don't have a creditcard or PayPal, but you want to donate anyway, please e-mail me. I send you other options to pay so that your donation can be transferred to my campaign. If you have any questions, feel free to contact me by mail info@evan-menswear.com.

Other ways you can help
* tell your friends, family and colleagues about my campaign
* Use the share tools for Facebook 

Like EVAN menswear on Facebook www.facebook.com/evanmenswear
Follow EVAN menswear on Instagram: www.oninstagram.com/evanmenswear

About EVAN menswear:

EVAN menswear is a new menswear label, with a fresh look at the needs of the man of today's world and inspired by the designer's fascination 'BEING CLASSY IS MY TEENAGE REBELLION'. Past and present as well as old and new meanings come together and create 'The New Businessman'. The collection is conceptual and at the same time wearable, with emphasis on overcoats, suits and distinctive jumpers. Focusing on functionality and details, EVAN menswear shows classic clean shapes and sportswear elements merging into a contemporary and new silhouette.

About Evaa Kuik:

Evaa Kuik is the young dutch designer behind the label EVAN menswear. She studied Fashion design at the Willem de Kooning Academy in Rotterdam. During her study she did an exchange at the Geneva University of Art and Design (HEAD) and an internship at designer Baartmans & Siegel in London. Last summer, June 2013 she graduated with honors with her collection 'Rebel on a Pause'. Evaa Kuik gets her inspiration from her fascination with subcultures, music, art and sports from the past en present. She is very happy to present her first EVAN menswear collection to the international fashion world at the Mercedes-Benz FashionWeek Amsterdam, January 25, 2014.

story:
Burel is a newly created French watchmaker founded in 2012 which draws its inspiration from the nautical world.

The brand became known through its first two models, the Class Yacht  and the Class Sail. The style of each is distinguished by the elegance of their faces of precious woods , which are based on boat decks.

Burel marine watches before all.

For the beginning of the year 2014 Burel wanted to create a new model inspired by nautical instrumentation. For this new model we decided to keep the precious nautical brand identity taken from the style and use of materials related to the nautical world . But we also wanted to highlight new time piece features never before put forth by the brand.  After several months of research and development ,  we arrived at a successful model.

We called this new model the CLASS CAPE. 

In order to offer our new Class Cape as an exclusive, we decided to launch this new model by creating a crowdfunding campaign .

Burel est une jeune maison horlogère française créée en 2012. Elle puise son imagination dans le monde nautique.

La marque s'est fait connaitre grâce à ses deux premiers modèles la Class Yacht et Class Sail, dont le style de chacun se distingue par l'élégance de leurs cadrans en bois précieux, qui s'inspirent des ponts de bateau.

La vocation de Burel est de créer des montres marine avant tout.

Pour ce début d'année 2014 Burel a souhaité concevoir un nouveau modèle s'inspirant de l'instrumentation nautique.  Pour ce nouveau modèle nous avions la volonté de garder l'identité nautique chère à la marque de part le style et l'utilisation de matériaux propres au monde nautique. Mais nous souhaitions aussi mettre en avant de nouvelles caractéristiques horlogères jusqu'à présent jamais exploité par la marque. Après plusieurs mois de recherche et développement, nous sommes donc arrivés à un modèle abouti.

Ce nouveau modèle, nous l'avons baptisé la CLASS CAPE

Afin de proposer notre nouvelle Class Cape en exclusivité, nous avons décidé de lancer ce nouveau modèle en créant une campagne de crowdfunding.

The Cape class.

The new Burel " CLASS CAPE " was inspired by nautical instrumentation.  It features compass graphics. Unlike a traditional watch, there are no hands .

Class Cape time reading is done by a red indicator line  superimposed on gradations of a carbon disc, as on a compass of navigation

The disk rotates clockwise, the hour and minute digits are graded from right to left .


La class Cape .

La nouvelle Burel « CLASS CAPE » s'inspire de l'instrumentation nautique. Elle reprend le graphisme du compas de navigation. Contrairement à une montre traditionnel, il n'y a pas d'aiguilles.

Sur la Class Cape lecture de l'heure s'effectue comme sur un compas de navigation, c'est-à-dire à l'aide de la ligne de foi rouge qui vient superposer les graduations du disque en carbone.

Le disque tourne dans le sens horaire, les chiffres des heures et minutes sont donc gradués de droite à gauche.



The Burel Class Cape is equipped with a mechanical Swiss ETA 6498 movement  which is reputed to be reliable and robust. The set is dressed in a black sail canvas strap. Like all Burel watches, the Class Cape has an international 2 year warranty.

La Burel Class Cape est équipée d'un mouvement mécanique suisse ETA 6498 qui est réputé fiable et robuste. L’ensemble est habillé d’un bracelet en toile de voile noir. Comme toutes les montres Burel, la class Cape a une garantie internationale de 2 ans.


Burel is a young brand already known on the watch market . We hope to launch this new model  early this year through a crownfunding campaign so that this will contribute to the development of the new brand.

Burel est une jeune marque déjà présente sur le marché horloger. Nous souhaitons en ce début d’année lancer ce nouveau modèle via une campagne de crownfunding afin que ceci contribue au développement de la jeune marque.


To give life to the new Class Cape we need your support. This will allow us to achieve the initial production of the Class Cape. If we raise more than the original budget , we can produce a larger stock and distribute Class Cape as well as the whole range of Burel products worldwide.

Participate in the Project and be the first to discover the Class Cape.

We offer the opportunity to acquire our new watch as an exclusive.

Some surprises will be reserved for you if the goal is reached before time ...

A Big thank you to all time sailors. 

Pour donner vie à la nouvelle Class Cape nous avons besoin de votre soutien. Cela nous permettra de réaliser une première production de la Class Cape. Si nous arrivons à récolter plus que budget de départ, nous pourrons produire un stock plus important et distribuer la class cape ainsi que l'ensemble de la gamme Burel à travers le monde.

Participer au Projet et soyer les premiers à découvrir la Class Cape.

Nous offrons donc la possibilité d'acquérir notre nouvelle montre en exclusivité.

Quelques surprises vous seront réservées si l'objectif est atteint avant l'heure...

Un Grand merci à tous les navigateurs du temps.

                


Find us / Retrouvez nous sûr:

www.burel-watch.com

facebook.com/burel.fr

story:
m-bro wants you to wear clothes.

But not just any clothes! Our clothes.

Who is m-bro?

m-bro is Gordon Widener & Derek Parrott. We run mbrosatellite.com and have done a variety of panels at anime conventions, a podcast about the same kind of things, and several videos of questionable quality that may not be about anything. We're nerds that sometimes are funny to other nerds. If you self-identify as a video game or anime nerd, you probably would find us kind of amusing. You may already find us amusing; and so here we are.

About The Shirt

Having been around conventions for almost ten years we have things to say about it. But since we can't walk around with you all day and make jokes about the convention, we decided to put a new joke in garment form. Something that rings true to anyone, anywhere, if you've ever stayed at a hotel during a nerd convention...

The elevators break. They get stuffed. And there are never, ever enough of them. This shirt is for those brave con warriors who know better than to wait over an hour for an elevator, especially when there's an angry Barret cosplayer with a real metal gun-arm, and he is determined to get on first.


These t-shirts will be printed on Tultex 0202 Cotton Short Sleeve shirts. They're a great deep red called Cardinal. Dare I say they look regal. The shirt stock is very similar to American Apparel, so you can expect a vintage-style fit. We are having them printed at VGKids, a local screenprinting house in Ypsilanti.

The Impact

Making a shirt isn't free, and we need help. We want to make at least 50 of these and we want to sell them at Youmacon 2011. We want people to already be wearing them when we get there. We want them to be quality and we want you to be happy with them. Ideally, we want to be able to come up with more clever shirts, stickers, magnets and other stuff that speaks to a group that still isn't very well-represented: the nerdy congoer who is a little more refined than shouting The Game in a crowded room.


What We Need & What You Get

We need $320 to get started. Our $320 goal wasn't just set on a dartboard - it's the number of orders we need to make 50 shirts. This is purely, solely the cost of the shirts; it doesn't cover setup costs we may incur nor does it cover any of our con-related expenses. 

If we go over that? We'll use it to make more shirts and/or put it towards a dealer's hall table. 

If we don't hit the goal - as long as we're over $160 we'll be able to do shirts for our contributors but won't be able to go past that. If we are under $160, we'll be putting the money into our giveaways for our panels and also for hosting costs for our website and podcast (it's not free!) ...and we'll still be doing pins that you'll get too.


So what's in it for you? Everyone who throws money in will get a shoutout on mbrosatellite.com! But you have to give us at least $20 to get a shirt. Up to 50 preorders are going to include an exclusive 1" pin which will never, ever be offered anywhere else ever, or even made again! You get the shoutout too! Give us $25 and you get a shirt, the exclusive pin, the shoutout, AND our first 1" pin set (4 pins total, not counting the preorder pin) - which we'll be unveiling here very soon! 

Want to go bigger? Ok. At $40 you'll get everything already listed plus if you have Skype, you can guest on an episode of our podcast! And at $50 - get everything above, plus a handwritten thank you note AND - you'll get an incredibly rare copy of the super-secret "m-bro Homecoming Photo"! These will only ever exist for those who give over $50, will never be produced ever again ever, and their existence will be denied! 


All physical items will be able to be picked up at Youmacon or shipping in time to arrive by Youmacon. (We expect to ship them earlier, but need to see what the turnaround time will be exactly.)

Other Ways You Can Help

Send your friends here! And also to mbrosatellite.com, our Twitter and Facebook! Tell them about our panels, play an episode of our podcast for them! Going to Youmacon? Bring your friends to our panels, and get on the youmacon.com forums and tell us why you're excited for our stuff! Email us suggestions - We want to talk to you!

And keep checking back here for updates!


UPDATED 6/29: Paypal is now accepted! YES

story:
Greetings!  I am Fashion Designer, Niiamar Felder.  And with your support I will present a spectacular Spring 2013 collection at New York Fashion Week in September!  That said, allow me to share the following information about my life and my love of fashion design.

ABOUT NIIAMAR

Inspired by the brilliance of Valentino, NIIAMAR avoids trends in favor of a more enduring style that has become the signature of his coveted designs.  His designs have been featured in several publications, fashion shows, theatre productions and national marketing campaigns.  He was nominated for the notable Marvin Sims Design Fellowship in Costume Design awarded by the Kennedy Center of the Performing Arts. While completing his undergraduate degree, he worked as a Design Assistant to renowned designer Kevan Hall in 2006.  Niiamar received a Bachelor of Fine Arts from Florida A&M University (FAMU) in 2007. 

In addition to designing stunning collections each season, Niiamar’s designs have been worn by Hollywood personalities to red carpet events, including the Academy Awards. Niiamar’s growing list of accomplishments include:  a feature in EBONY Magazine; presentation of his spring collection during NYC Fashion Week in 2010; featured designer at the 2011 Women Who Care Luncheon.  As a contestant on Lifetime's "24 Hour Catwalk", Niiamar impressed the panel of celebrity judges with his attention to detail and exceptional design aesthetics.  He has served as Principal Costume Designer for the off Broadway productions of “The Doll Confessions” directed by Tony Award Winner Trezana Beverley and Cole Porter’s “Kiss Me Kate.”

Please visit my web site www.niiamar.com to view my collections and learn more about my journey into the world of fashion.  It is my hope that you will be even more inspired to make a donation.

What (funding) I need and where it's going.

Over the years producing a fashion line has become increasingly expensive and this collection will cost about $20,000 which is a fairly low cost. All of the proceedes raised will be used wisely to purchase fabric, cost of seamstress/pattern sample maker, *(creating the actual 2D designs) hair stylist and make up artist, models, press, and other miscellanous cost that will go directly into producing the Spring 2013 presentation.

Where the funds will go if I don't reach my entire goal

If the $20,000 goal is not reached ( though I am optimistic that we will) the funds raised will still be used to support the efforts in producing the Spring 2013 Presentation. We are also using other fundraising methods to ensure that we reach our expected finanical goal. The show must go on!

The signifigance of presenting my spring collection at NYC Fashion Week in September 

Fashion is one of the most universal ways to express who you are, without saying a word. And to express you in great style and luxury makes it even better.  This project has the potential to launch me, a true talented designer phenom and brand into the forefront of the fashion world and most importantly introducing more diversity which is needed in the fashion industry.  It is not only my desire to become the first Black American to show couture collections in Paris, but I ultimately want to continue in my passion in a greater way, and that is nurturing and educating the next generations of designers.  YOU giving to this project will not only assist me, but also others to continue in the passion of creating beautiful and timeless fashion.

Please join me in making this happen!  And you may do so in more than one way...donate, post to your faceook page and share this information with your friends too (see the Indiegogo share tools for facebook, twitter, etc.)  With your support I can realize my dream to my first exclusive show at NEW YORK FASHION WEEK in September! Thank you and God bless!

 

Ciao!

NIIAMAR
story_txt:
Greetings!  I am Fashion Designer, Niiamar Felder.  And with your support I will present a spectacular Spring 2013 collection at New York Fashion Week in September!  That said, allow me to share the following information about my life and my love of fashion design.
ABOUT NIIAMAR
Inspired by the brilliance of Valentino, NIIAMAR avoids trends in favor of a more enduring style that has become the signature of his coveted designs.  His designs have been featured in several publications, fashion shows, theatre productions and national marketing campaigns.  He was nominated for the notable Marvin Sims Design Fellowship in Costume Design awarded by the Kennedy Center of the Performing Arts. While completing his undergraduate degree, he worked as a Design Assistant to renowned designer Kevan Hall in 2006.  Niiamar received a Bachelor of Fine Arts from Florida A&M University (FAMU) in 2007. 
In addition to designing stunning collections each season, Niiamar’s designs have been worn by Hollywood personalities to red carpet events, including the Academy Awards. Niiamar’s growing list of accomplishments include:  a feature in EBONY Magazine; presentation of his spring collection during NYC Fashion Week in 2010; featured designer at the 2011 Women Who Care Luncheon.  As a contestant on Lifetime's "24 Hour Catwalk", Niiamar impressed the panel of celebrity judges with his attention to detail and exceptional design aesthetics.  He has served as Principal Costume Designer for the off Broadway productions of “The Doll Confessions” directed by Tony Award Winner Trezana Beverley and Cole Porter’s “Kiss Me Kate.”
Please visit my web site www.niiamar.com to view my collections and learn more about my journey into the world of fashion.  It is my hope that you will be even more inspired to make a donation.
What (funding) I need and where it's going.

Over the years producing a fashion line has become increasingly expensive and this collection will cost about $20,000 which is a fairly low cost. All of the proceedes raised will be used wisely to purchase fabric, cost of seamstress/pattern sample maker, *(creating the actual 2D designs) hair stylist and make up artist, models, press, and other miscellanous cost that will go directly into producing the Spring 2013 presentation.

If the $20,000 goal is not reached ( though I am optimistic that we will) the funds raised will still be used to support the efforts in producing the Spring 2013 Presentation. We are also using other fundraising methods to ensure that we reach our expected finanical goal. The show must go on!
The signifigance of presenting my spring collection at NYC Fashion Week in September  
Fashion is one of the most universal ways to express who you are, without saying a word. And to express you in great style and luxury makes it even better.  This project has the potential to launch me, a true talented designer phenom and brand into the forefront of the fashion world and most importantly introducing more diversity which is needed in the fashion industry.  It is not only my desire to become the first Black American to show couture collections in Paris, but I ultimately want to continue in my passion in a greater way, and that is nurturing and educating the next generations of designers.  YOU giving to this project will not only assist me, but also others to continue in the passion of creating beautiful and timeless fashion.
Please join me in making this happen!  And you may do so in more than one way...donate, post to your faceook page and share this information with your friends too (see the Indiegogo share tools for facebook, twitter, etc.)  With your support I can realize my dream to my first exclusive show at NEW YORK FASHION WEEK in September! Thank you and God bless!

story:
Short Summary

 We are Dynasty and Soull of L’Enchanteur, a LifeStyle brand, which houses apparel, jewelry, and home décor, among other adornments. L’Enchanteur bridges the gap between High Fine Quality wear and everyday existence.

 Our campaign is focused on funding the final draft of our Fall/Winter 2013 collection, printing copies our look book for prospective Buyers and Boutiques, the shipping of our product overseas, as well purchasing our tickets to Berlin, Germany, where we will be showcasing our collection at the 2013 Bread+Butter Tradeshow in Berlin. BREAD & BUTTER(http://www.breadandbutter.com/winter2013-bigtim...) is THE fashion tradeshow for selected brands, based in Berlin, providing the concept of an innovative trade fair event for the progressive, contemporary clothing culture.
As an international specialist trade fair for Street and Urban Wear, BREAD & BUTTER represents a marketing and communication platform for only the top brands, labels and designers.
 With a unique brand portfolio, BREAD & BUTTER confirms its position as the leading international trade fair and trademark – it is the meeting point for buyers, traders and representatives from textile, industry & press. Under the tagline “Fun and Profit”, we continue being a benchmark for extraordinary business, integrating festival like features such as concerts, side-events & other surprising activities.

 This has been an amazing journey for L’Enchanteur, mainly because we’ve been striving to bring our work to a point of major recognition and an opportunity to expand our brand globally. This is the chance for us to use the opportunity presented to us and allow us to show the world what we are capable of. All of our funding is out of pocket and production is very expensive. We strive for excellence in this collection and work towards our goal being accomplished. Your contribution, in any way, will help bring our work and dreams of becoming a house hold name on a global scale come into fruition. Your contribution to this campaign means we make take the trip to Berlin, where we can present our collection at the Bread & Butter tradeshow. We will be able to produce the samples and the look books which buyers can shop through and purchase our merchandise in order for our brand to be sold globally. We will also be able to fund our shipping overseas as well as the first order of shipment we will receive after our samples are completed.  

What We Need & What You Get

We are aiming to raise $10,000. The $10,000 will go to our cost of producing the collection in it's entirety (Fabric, metalwork, manufacturing, producing samples, producing the lookbook, flying L'Enchanteur roundtrip to/from  Belrin, Germany to show the collection, ship our collection with us overseas. The ability to produce the collection fully after the samples have been completed.

 

$25 YOU WILL GRANTED A THANK YOU AND GREAT KARMA

 
$50 YOU WILL GRANTED THE ABOVE + A L'ENCHANTEUR BADGE PIN & "HELLO" POSTCARD FROM GERMANY
 
$100 YOU WILL BE GRANTED THE ABOVE + L'ENCHANTEUR SPECIAL EDITION T-SHIRT
 
$250 OR MORE YOU WILL BE GRANTED THE ABOVE + AN ID-BRACELET
 
$500 OR MORE YOU WILL BE GRANTED ALL THE ABOVE PLUS THE L'ENCHANTEUR DUFFLE BAG
 
$1000 OR MORE YOU WILL BE GRANTED ALL OF THE ABOVE + A CUSTOMIZED PAIR OF PANTELONES OR A CUSTOMIZED (INITIAL) CREST RING

 

 The funds will still go to producing the first wave of the collection (The 1st half of the samples, producing half the lookbooks) and still aim to get us as least one-way tickets to Berlin.

If we can get most of the production completed, some look books printed and 1-way tickets to Berlin, we still have a shot at showing something magnificent with what we are working with. 

The Impact

This campaign is assisting in the journey of twin sisters who are bringing their brand to the light. When someone contributes to our campaign, they are simultaneously contributing to our journey. They join us on this path of getting out our dreams. Each donation makes a huge impact on our mission. Every bit aids and huge donation takes our ultimate goal to another level. Every single dollar counts. With the help of others we would be thrilled to thank them with our gifts to them, to show our appreciation for even the thought of helping and ultimately the one love and togetherness it attracts.

All the pieces matter -L'Enchanteur

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute with money, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help in other ways:

It's alright if you don't have the funds to help, word of mouth can help just the same. Let's buld the momentum for this campaign. Share this link with you friends and family. Like us on FB. Follow our tumblr page to get a better idea of who we are and what we do. Share it. Words spread like fire. Lets ignite the flame. 

Share, Share, Share the gift.

story:
Carrier for laptop bags and briefcases on the bicycle

          

             

 

            

                

                  

 

The story of BusyBasket TM

My name is Diana, I live in Zagreb, Croatia, Europe, I am a professional journalist,  book and screenplay writer, award-winning innovator and the owner of the Jupiteriana, company for inventing of new products. I like to think up new things in various areas of creativity.

But the main role here plays BusyBasket, my innovation, so here is the story:

The Idea to innovate BusyBasket came to me when I myself have experienced a problem known  to all cyclists – how to carry a larger bag on the bike, like laptop bag, briefcase, school bag, sport bag, grocery bag... I ride my bike to work every day, of course, carying my laptop. If I wear it on the handlebar, it hinders while driving, on the shoulder it disturbs the balance, and I cannot even think of carrying something so valuable on the rear rack! Soon, I noticed that others were having this problem also. The same happens with the suitcases and other large bags or packages.

As I could not find any basket that would solve this problem I created it myself. The realization of my idea and creating a new product went like this: first there were sketches on my table, then first model in my garage, and then a dozen prototypes in the workshop of a local craftsman. When I presented my innovation in my cycling association, and to my friends who liked it very much, I was overjoyed, so I named it BusyBasket, registrated as industrial design and presented it at two international innovation shows.  I won two gold medals! Feedback was excellent and I belive that my innovation could have a bright future!

After that I gathered a team, all cycling enthusiasts and we started with a first small serial production. That is how the first generation of BusyBasket was created which I am presenting you here.

I have been able to cover the expanses of the industrial design process, legal fees, prototyping and first tooling and manufacturing by myself.

Our wish is to develop BusyBasket further. Our design and marketing team plan to develop a second generation of BusyBasket which will have even better design that will be more suitable for mass production. We also plan to present BusyBasket to the world market.

And that is why we need your financial help!

We have prepared a limited amount of first generation BusyBasket carrier, and other great perks with BusyBasket logo. Please support our project and enable us to continue developing BusyBasket which will benefit and help all cyclists – and there is more of us every day! :-)

You can also help very much by forwarding the link of this project to your friends cyclists, bike associations and clubs... and anyone that you think might be interested!

We are most grateful for all your contributions, thank you in advance! :-)

 And here are the perks:
