story:
A Musk Ox, A Cashmere Goat and a Vicuna Walk Into A Bar ...

Deadly. Actually, despite its name Musk Ox are part of the goat family. They are prehistoric mammals that roamed the arctic regions of the planet with mastodons and wooly mammoths during the Pleistocene Era and survived the Ice Age. Today, Musk Ox can be found in significant numbers in only three places: Alaska, northern Canada and Greenland, all among the most inhospitable winter climates on earth.

The Musk Ox's ability to survive in such conditions is largely due to the phenomenal insulating capability of its hair. At the same time, this protective hair is finer than cashmere resulting, when knitted or woven, in a fabric that is unparalleled in hand feel. This campaign will bring these incredible qualities to a select few Founding Funders who support the creation of a jacket and, ultimately, the creation of a complete luxury fashion line like no other.


The Origin

The Qiviut Jacket began its history in Alaska where I lived for twenty years after growing up in New York City. Alaska is truly a wonderful place, known as much for its natural beauty and abundant wildlife as it is for its harsh winters and sub-zero temperatures. It was because of these latter conditions, however, that I first became aware of Musk Ox and how suitable their hair was for arctic temperatures.

The use of qiviut to this point in time has been exclusively to spin it into yarn for sale to home hobbyists who hand knit the occasional sweater, scarf, beanie, etc. However, what works for musk oxen should work for humans on a larger scale and I explored using this remarkable fibre as the basis for a clothing line in Alaska but quickly realized it would be too expensive for that market and abandoned the idea.

Fast forward ten years, during which time the internet has made global marketing a reality, and I am now living in London, one of the great fashion capitals of the world. The stars had aligned to resurrect the idea of creating a brand of luxury garments based upon the use of qiviut and the past 18 months have been spent doing just that. 


Sourcing the Fibre

The initial challenge was to find a reliable source of quality qiviut that could supply in commercial quantity. To date and as mentioned, qiviut has been used only on a small scale for spinning into yarn sold to home hobbyists who knit a garment by hand. Until now, no one had ever attempted to use it for mass manufacturing even on a limited edition basis. Typically, qiviut can only be sourced once a year in late winter/early spring when the musk oxen molt or are allowed to be hunted for meat under strict government control, primarily by subsistence natives who then sell off the hides for fur harvesting. It is definitely a cottage industry process and, therefore, inefficient and costly. But it is the only way to source the fibre. In Alaska, having the smallest number of Musk Ox, there was no commercial source of supply but I was lucky enough to find two dedicated qiviut processors, one in northern Canada, home to the world's largest population of wild Musk Ox, and the other in western Greenland.

The next part of the process was finding the expertise and craftsmen who could properly integrate the fibre into a manufacturing process. 

High Performance Insulation Without Bulk

For example, let's talk about insulation. Almost all other luxury high performance outerwear use feathers or synthetics or a combination of both to insulate against the cold. These materials lend themselves to a mechanized process because they can be laid in or blown into the insulating cavity (between the outer shell and inner lining) of a garment. When using hair, particularly hair as fine as qiviut, there is no automated way to fill the insulation cavity. Through a lot of trial and error, our specialized manufacturing facility came up with the 'sandwich' method of insulation: laying the Musk Ox hair by hand  between two layers of ThermolitePro™ high performance synthetic. This maximizes warmth while minimizing bulk (to avoid the 'Michelin Man look').




Spinning, Knitting and Finishing - All in England

A similar challenge was locating the right vendor who could handle the spinning of the ultra-fine qiviut fibre with luxury grade Super Fine Merino wool and King Baby  Alpaca to make the bespoke yarn that would allow the jacket's knitted arctic collar and trim to have the sensuous hand feel that only this unique mixture can yield while still providing a snugness and thermal performance to protect against the most severe wind and cold. This I was able to do in England using an established family owned firm in Cornwall specializing in small batch yarn spinning. The bespoke yarn then went to an artisan knitting facility in Leicester for completion of the trim and then to a century old fabric finishing facility in Huddersfield  before being sent for final assembly matching up the trim with the jacket shell.


The final major piece of the puzzle was securing design talent that could envision a luxury jacket worthy of the name. Luckily, such talent exists in abundance in London as one of the fashion capitals of the world and the result is an understated, elegant and versatile garment that is equally at home on the slopes St Moritz or the platforms of St Pancras.





This campaign is the precursor to the roll-out of a full line of qiviut clothing for AW 2016-17 (think sweaters, scarves, gilets, vests, etc.). Money raised in this campaign will help fund the acquisition of raw materials, design development and the expanded infrastructure necessary to make, market and fulfill a QIVIUT & CO Concept Line, all in limited edition men's and women's garments and accessories, online only, direct to consumer. 



How You Can Help

As mentioned above and unlike most people who crowdfund, I am not using Indiegogo to raise money to manufacture or for working capital equity. The effort to bring The Qiviut Jacket to market has been entirely self-funded and the jackets will be available for fulfillment almost immediately at the beginning of February. What I do need your help for is to establish the viability of qiviut products in the luxury end of the fashion market at luxury price points. I believe that selling 500 of a single qiviut item this winter will do that. In other words, it will provide a successful proof of concept that will lay the groundwork in all sorts of ways to establish the brand and a completely new category in luxury fashion. 
And that is why selling the first 100 jackets on Indiegogo is so important. It will provide initial traction, stimulate a media/social network buzz and create some name recognition faster than any other sales methodology, at least for a start-up with limited marketing resources. 
 *Please see the FAQ section for instructions on sizing and details of exchanges.
Why such a generous Perks scheme? It's simple. I want to show my appreciation for the  select few early adopters who are willing to place their faith in my concept and want to be part of a new, exclusive brand from the very beginning. The 100 Founding Funders will provide credibility, media attention and momentum to fuel the sale of the remaining jackets which, in turn, will help establish the brand as a full line next year. It's a straightforward business model.

The Perks

I also don't want to overlook people who can't be Founding Funders but still want to support the concept and be involved with the project. So, hopefully, one of the other rewards will be appealing, unique and show my appreciation as good value for money. So, here are the Perks to which you can subscribe:

The Qiviut Jacket

This will always be our flagship quilted garment in the QIVIUT & CO line. A superbly crafted jacket consisting of a water and stain resistant polyester outer shell insulated with a mixture of 100% Canadian qiviut, musk ox guard hair and Thermolite Pro™ synthetic, trimmed with a knitted mixture of Greenland qiviut, alpaca and superfine merino wool. Lined with a QIVIUT & CO jacquard print lining. Detachable arctic collar, hood and hood trim. Dry clean only. S,M,L,XL.
Comes in bespoke packaging with The Qiviut Card, Certificate of Authenticity identifying jacket number and carrier bag for transport or storage.



The Qiviut Jacket Duo

The Qiviut Jacket x 2 with increased savings. Jackets numbered in sequence. S,M,L,XL. Free shipping.

Adopt A Musk Ox

Offered in conjunction with the Musk Ox Farm in Palmer, Alaska, a non-profit dedicated to the domestication of the Musk Ox and the promotion of qiviut production. This Perk entitles you to choose the Musk Ox to be adopted for one year, receive a photograph of your Musk Ox, an adoption certificate, a one-day family pass to visit your new friend in Alaska (or a season pass for one if you live there) and a subscription to The Friends of the Musk Ox Newsletter. Funds from this Perk are entirely used by the Musk Ox Farm for the feeding and veterinary care of the adopted animal. Further details of the Perk can be found on the Musk Ox Farm website <The Musk Ox Farm Adoption Program>

QIVIUT & CO T-Shirt

                                                                                




What would any crowdfunding campaign be without a t-shirt perk but this one is special. Made from carbon brushed 100% luxury pre-shrunk cotton for a fabulous hand feel, this shirt sports a stylized silk screened musk ox logo on the front and a subtle embroidered company logo at the back neck. A great ice breaker... 'What kind of ox?'...'Ki-vee-what?' White only. S,M,L,XL,XXL. Free shipping.

Whether or not you choose to fund, what you can do to show support for this project is to simply spread the word via the share tools on this site, by e-mailing friends and contacts or by using your social media platform(s) of choice. QIVIUT & CO can only become a viable luxury brand if people know about it and there is no such thing as a bad referral or recommendation. I thank you in advance for whatever you can do.

FAQs

A full range of FAQs can be found on the QIVIUT & CO website but let me highlight three of the most important:

Return and Exchange Policy

Returns:
Our return policy is quite simple: You can return a jacket in its original condition (unworn and undamaged with all original packaging and garment tags)  at any time within 30 days of purchase for a full refund, no questions asked. Returns are accomplished by contacting us by e-mail at concierge@qiviutandco.com  for a Returns/Exchange Form or by downloading it here. We aim to respond within 24 hours with detailed return instructions. Refunds can only be made by crediting the original purchaser’s form of payment. 

Exchanges:
Exchanges may also be requested within 30 days of purchase by the same e-mail process but are a bit more complicated because of the numbering and registration of each jacket and the limited availability of sizes. A jacket once numbered on a Certificate of Authenticity always retains its 1-500 number but is linked in our database to a unique serial number on the garment. The jacket number will be permanently referenced to the initial buyer or his or her designee. However, the serial number to which the jacket number is linked will change upon an exchange and a new Certificate of Authenticity issued. While we will always try to accommodate exchanges insofar as possible, because of the limited edition of The Qiviut Jacket a desired size may not be available. Where a satisfactory exchange cannot be accomplished a full refund will be made by crediting the original purchaser’s form of payment. Please download the Returns/Exchange Form and send the completed form to concierge@qiviutandco.com.

Shipping Information

For this proof of concept effort involving just 500 of The Qiviut Jacket, we are offering free shipping but selling only to destinations in North America and Western Europe (see complete list of countries here).

Shipping is free to any of these destinations and done on a Destination Duty Paid basis. In other words, the price you see is the full and complete price that you pay. For all shipments of The Qiviut Jacket in the United Kingdom we use DPD as our designated shipper. For the rest of the world we use DHL. Both companies offer end to end tracking service and you can be notified by e-mail or text of the status of your order. Once jackets are in stock delivery time to all UK destinations is typically 1-2 business days and for other destinations 2-5 business days. All shipments require a signature upon delivery.

In the event of a return or exchange, shipping is also free from the above mentioned areas of the world, or payable by buyer from elsewhere, and can be initiated  by contacting us by e-mail at concierge@qiviutandco.com or by completing and submitting a Return/Exchange Form. We aim to reply within 24 hours with detailed return or exchange instructions.

Sizing Information

The only variable in The Qiviut Jacket is size and because exchanges are expensive for us and inconvenient for customers, we want to make sure that our Founding Funders select the correct size as much as they do. Therefore, please consult our size chart, measurement specifications and measurement instructions here before selecting your size. Taking the time to verify your measurements against those of the size jacket you order will help ensure receiving the correct size jacket straight away and minimize the potential disappointment of an an unsuccessful exchange for a different size that may no longer be available.





Contact US

For further information or any questions you can contact us by:
Phone: +44 (0800) 840-3958 / +1 (844) 228-3958
E-mail: info@qiviutandco.com
Web: www.qiviutandco.com
Mail: 9 Jerdan Place, Unit 315, London SW6 1BE, UK

story_txt:
A Musk Ox, A Cashmere Goat and a Vicuna Walk Into A Bar ...


Deadly. Actually, despite its name Musk Ox are part of the goat family. They are prehistoric mammals that roamed the arctic regions of the planet with mastodons and wooly mammoths during the Pleistocene Era and survived the Ice Age. Today, Musk Ox can be found in significant numbers in only three places: Alaska, northern Canada and Greenland, all among the most inhospitable winter climates on earth. 
The Musk Ox's ability to survive in such conditions is largely due to the phenomenal insulating capability of its hair. At the same time, this protective hair is finer than cashmere resulting, when knitted or woven, in a fabric that is unparalleled in hand feel. This campaign will bring these incredible qualities to a select few Founding Funders who support the creation of a jacket and, ultimately, the creation of a complete luxury fashion line like no other.

The Origin
 The Qiviut Jacket began its history in Alaska where I lived for twenty years after growing up in New York City. Alaska is truly a wonderful place, known as much for its natural beauty and abundant wildlife as it is for its harsh winters and sub-zero temperatures. It was because of these latter conditions, however, that I first became aware of Musk Ox and how suitable their hair was for arctic temperatures.

The use of qiviut to this point in time has been exclusively to spin it into yarn for sale to home hobbyists who hand knit the occasional sweater, scarf, beanie, etc. However, what works for musk oxen should work for humans on a larger scale and I explored using this remarkable fibre as the basis for a clothing line in Alaska but quickly realized it would be too expensive for that market and abandoned the idea.

 Fast forward ten years, during which time the internet has made global marketing a reality, and I am now living in London, one of the great fashion capitals of the world. The stars had aligned to resurrect the idea of creating a brand of luxury garments based upon the use of qiviut and the past 18 months have been spent doing just that. 






Sourcing the Fibre
The initial challenge was to find a reliable source of quality qiviut that could supply in commercial quantity. To date and as mentioned, qiviut has been used only on a small scale for spinning into yarn sold to home hobbyists who knit a garment by hand. Until now, no one had ever attempted to use it for mass manufacturing even on a limited edition basis. Typically, qiviut can only be sourced once a year in late winter/early spring when the musk oxen molt or are allowed to be hunted for meat under strict government control, primarily by subsistence natives who then sell off the hides for fur harvesting. It is definitely a cottage industry process and, therefore, inefficient and costly. But it is the only way to source the fibre. In Alaska, having the smallest number of Musk Ox, there was no commercial source of supply but I was lucky enough to find two dedicated qiviut processors, one in northern Canada, home to the world's largest population of wild Musk Ox, and the other in western Greenland.



The next part of the process was finding the expertise and craftsmen who could properly integrate the fibre into a manufacturing process. 
High Performance Insulation Without Bulk
For example, let's talk about insulation. Almost all other luxury high performance outerwear use feathers or synthetics or a combination of both to insulate against the cold. These materials lend themselves to a mechanized process because they can be laid in or blown into the insulating cavity (between the outer shell and inner lining) of a garment. When using hair, particularly hair as fine as qiviut, there is no automated way to fill the insulation cavity. Through a lot of trial and error, our specialized manufacturing facility came up with the 'sandwich' method of insulation: laying the Musk Ox hair by hand  between two layers of ThermolitePro™ high performance synthetic. This maximizes warmth while minimizing bulk (to avoid the 'Michelin Man look').









Spinning, Knitting and Finishing - All in England
A similar challenge was locating the right vendor who could handle the spinning of the ultra-fine qiviut fibre with luxury grade Super Fine Merino wool and King Baby  Alpaca to make the bespoke yarn that would allow the jacket's knitted arctic collar and trim to have the sensuous hand feel that only this unique mixture can yield while still providing a snugness and thermal performance to protect against the most severe wind and cold. This I was able to do in England using an established family owned firm in Cornwall specializing in small batch yarn spinning. The bespoke yarn then went to an artisan knitting facility in Leicester for completion of the trim and then to a century old fabric finishing facility in Huddersfield  before being sent for final assembly matching up the trim with the jacket shell.


The final major piece of the puzzle was securing design talent that could envision a luxury jacket worthy of the name. Luckily, such talent exists in abundance in London as one of the fashion capitals of the world and the result is an understated, elegant and versatile garment that is equally at home on the slopes St Moritz or the platforms of St Pancras.















This campaign is the precursor to the roll-out of a full line of qiviut clothing for AW 2016-17 (think sweaters, scarves, gilets, vests, etc.). Money raised in this campaign will help fund the acquisition of raw materials, design development and the expanded infrastructure necessary to make, market and fulfill a QIVIUT & CO Concept Line, all in limited edition men's and women's garments and accessories, online only, direct to consumer. 


How You Can Help
As mentioned above and unlike most people who crowdfund, I am not using Indiegogo to raise money to manufacture or for working capital equity. The effort to bring The Qiviut Jacket to market has been entirely self-funded and the jackets will be available for fulfillment almost immediately at the beginning of February. What I do need your help for is to establish the viability of qiviut products in the luxury end of the fashion market at luxury price points. I believe that selling 500 of a single qiviut item this winter will do that. In other words, it will provide a successful proof of concept that will lay the groundwork in all sorts of ways to establish the brand and a completely new category in luxury fashion. 
And that is why selling the first 100 jackets on Indiegogo is so important. It will provide initial traction, stimulate a media/social network buzz and create some name recognition faster than any other sales methodology, at least for a start-up with limited marketing resources. 
 *Please see the FAQ section for instructions on sizing and details of exchanges.

Why such a generous Perks scheme? It's simple. I want to show my appreciation for the  select few early adopters who are willing to place their faith in my concept and want to be part of a new, exclusive brand from the very beginning. The 100 Founding Funders will provide credibility, media attention and momentum to fuel the sale of the remaining jackets which, in turn, will help establish the brand as a full line next year. It's a straightforward business model.
The PerksI also don't want to overlook people who can't be Founding Funders but still want to support the concept and be involved with the project. So, hopefully, one of the other rewards will be appealing, unique and show my appreciation as good value for money. So, here are the Perks to which you can subscribe:The Qiviut JacketThis will always be our flagship quilted garment in the QIVIUT & CO line. A superbly crafted jacket consisting of a water and stain resistant polyester outer shell insulated with a mixture of 100% Canadian qiviut, musk ox guard hair and Thermolite Pro™ synthetic, trimmed with a knitted mixture of Greenland qiviut, alpaca and superfine merino wool. Lined with a QIVIUT & CO jacquard print lining. Detachable arctic collar, hood and hood trim. Dry clean only. S,M,L,XL.Comes in bespoke packaging with The Qiviut Card, Certificate of Authenticity identifying jacket number and carrier bag for transport or storage.





The Qiviut Jacket Duo



The Qiviut Jacket x 2 with increased savings. Jackets numbered in sequence. S,M,L,XL. Free shipping.Adopt A Musk OxOffered in conjunction with the Musk Ox Farm in Palmer, Alaska, a non-profit dedicated to the domestication of the Musk Ox and the promotion of qiviut production. This Perk entitles you to choose the Musk Ox to be adopted for one year, receive a photograph of your Musk Ox, an adoption certificate, a one-day family pass to visit your new friend in Alaska (or a season pass for one if you live there) and a subscription to The Friends of the Musk Ox Newsletter. Funds from this Perk are entirely used by the Musk Ox Farm for the feeding and veterinary care of the adopted animal. Further details of the Perk can be found on the Musk Ox Farm website <The Musk Ox Farm Adoption Program>QIVIUT & CO T-Shirt                                                                                









What would any crowdfunding campaign be without a t-shirt perk but this one is special. Made from carbon brushed 100% luxury pre-shrunk cotton for a fabulous hand feel, this shirt sports a stylized silk screened musk ox logo on the front and a subtle embroidered company logo at the back neck. A great ice breaker... 'What kind of ox?'...'Ki-vee-what?' White only. S,M,L,XL,XXL. Free shipping.
Whether or not you choose to fund, what you can do to show support for this project is to simply spread the word via the share tools on this site, by e-mailing friends and contacts or by using your social media platform(s) of choice. QIVIUT & CO can only become a viable luxury brand if people know about it and there is no such thing as a bad referral or recommendation. I thank you in advance for whatever you can do.
FAQs
A full range of FAQs can be found on the QIVIUT & CO website but let me highlight three of the most important:
Return and Exchange Policy
Returns:Our return policy is quite simple: You can return a jacket in its original condition (unworn and undamaged with all original packaging and garment tags)  at any time within 30 days of purchase for a full refund, no questions asked. Returns are accomplished by contacting us by e-mail at concierge@qiviutandco.com  for a Returns/Exchange Form or by downloading it here. We aim to respond within 24 hours with detailed return instructions. Refunds can only be made by crediting the original purchaser’s form of payment. 
Exchanges:Exchanges may also be requested within 30 days of purchase by the same e-mail process but are a bit more complicated because of the numbering and registration of each jacket and the limited availability of sizes. A jacket once numbered on a Certificate of Authenticity always retains its 1-500 number but is linked in our database to a unique serial number on the garment. The jacket number will be permanently referenced to the initial buyer or his or her designee. However, the serial number to which the jacket number is linked will change upon an exchange and a new Certificate of Authenticity issued. While we will always try to accommodate exchanges insofar as possible, because of the limited edition of The Qiviut Jacket a desired size may not be available. Where a satisfactory exchange cannot be accomplished a full refund will be made by crediting the original purchaser’s form of payment. Please download the Returns/Exchange Form and send the completed form to concierge@qiviutandco.com.

Shipping Information
For this proof of concept effort involving just 500 of The Qiviut Jacket, we are offering free shipping but selling only to destinations in North America and Western Europe (see complete list of countries here).
Shipping is free to any of these destinations and done on a Destination Duty Paid basis. In other words, the price you see is the full and complete price that you pay. For all shipments of The Qiviut Jacket in the United Kingdom we use DPD as our designated shipper. For the rest of the world we use DHL. Both companies offer end to end tracking service and you can be notified by e-mail or text of the status of your order. Once jackets are in stock delivery time to all UK destinations is typically 1-2 business days and for other destinations 2-5 business days. All shipments require a signature upon delivery.
In the event of a return or exchange, shipping is also free from the above mentioned areas of the world, or payable by buyer from elsewhere, and can be initiated  by contacting us by e-mail at concierge@qiviutandco.com or by completing and submitting a Return/Exchange Form. We aim to reply within 24 hours with detailed return or exchange instructions.
Sizing Information
The only variable in The Qiviut Jacket is size and because exchanges are expensive for us and inconvenient for customers, we want to make sure that our Founding Funders select the correct size as much as they do. Therefore, please consult our size chart, measurement specifications and measurement instructions here before selecting your size. Taking the time to verify your measurements against those of the size jacket you order will help ensure receiving the correct size jacket straight away and minimize the potential disappointment of an an unsuccessful exchange for a different size that may no longer be available.










Contact US
For further information or any questions you can contact us by:

E-mail: info@qiviutandco.com

Web: www.qiviutandco.com

story:
The ID EST JEANS brand was founded by me, Luigi Chiechi and my wife Angela in 2008 to produce and commercialize a women's premium luxury denim product.  We are a family-run business and take pride in our "non corporate" status keeping in line with a long family tradition in the apparel sector.  We cure our product personally from selecting the fabrics, to controlling each new design, to watching over the complete production run, up to the boxing and shipment of each jean.  Riding the wave of over 30 years of experience in the Fashion sector, I decided it was time to use this experience to create a new "user friendly"  and "eco" friendly denim jean that makes each customer feel great to slip a pair on.  Comfort and Styling is paramount here at ID EST Jeans.

Now, I need to take the brand to the "Next Level" by raising funds to increase production and create a higher brand awareness in new markets thoughout the world.  Funds gathered will be used to sponser "Denim"  Fashion events in each new market we enter, participate at sector trade shows in Europe and North America allowing the brand to be seen by more major department store and boutique buyers, create new ranges and denim products such as denim skirts, denim jackets, and denim shirts to enhance the current denim collection, create a new web portal which will enable all our friends and customers to order our product directly from us through a new e-commerce website, and to overall promote ID EST Jeans as a unique and tailor made garment.

A new increase in working capital will allow the brand to be more competitive by increasing current production runs and lowering the average cost per item, thus reducing the price point to the consumer.

My wife and I would be very happy to receive your thoughts and comments regarding suggestions on where we could place our product in your market,  allowing all of you to participate in making the brand grow. Just contact us! We both thank you all very much for your kind consideration of our project.

Luigi & Angela Chiechi

ID EST Jeans and Apparel

story:
As a next-to-skin piece of clothing, your base layer plays a fundamental role in pulling moisture away from your body and regulating your core temperature.

When you're travelling you need a base layer that performs at an even higher level than regular apparel to keep you comfortable in fluctuating climate transitions.

By using an advanced merino hybrid fabric and fusing it with a minimal design aesthetic, we believe we have created the best base layer for travel.

The most advanced moisture wicking technology
For the material, we partnered with Polartec to create a custom bi-component fabric that combines the distinct advantages of merino and synthetic fibres. It is absolutely the best no-compromise merino hybrid fabric available.

Designed for superior performance
Engineered with gusseted armpits to provide exceptional freedom of movement and natural range of motion for use across any athletic pursuit or adventure.

Versatile and classic aesthetic
All the pieces in the collection are designed to look good in any situation. They are made to look great layered up with a jacket or used to dress down a suit or simply on their own. 

Thoughtful and considered details
Including thumb holes on the long sleeves to keep your hands warm in cold conditions and an asymmetrical hem for a subtle aesthetic detail and extra range of motion.


You'll love wearing the short sleeve base layers by themselves in warm weather and the long sleeves during winter. 

Our henleys are especially versatile in being able to create extra ventilation for cooling or heating to where it matters most.

With odor and wrinkle resistance and you have a base layer that is perfect for travel to any destination in any condition.

In choosing a fabric composition, merino and synthetics were our first natural choices. But each came with their own distinct advantages and limitations. 

We love merino because soft and handles moisture well, but becomes unstable after heavy use Synthetic fibres are more durable and wicking efficient but can't match the next to skin comfort as merino.

And the problem mixing both yarns causes an overall reduction on the inherent benefits and performance. And when we came across Polartec PowerWool we knew we had found the perfect base layer fabric.

By bypassing traditional retail and selling to you online we able to offer you significant discounts. This makes the value proposition of purchasing base layers made with Polartec PowerWool hard to beat. Also by preselling on Indiegogo, we are able to further offer you the deepest discounts we will ever offer.

We produce timeless, everyday essentials that are designed to last. We believe that the clothing you wear every day should be comfortable, good looking and functional. Our goal is to help you declutter your daily routine, save money and time, and focus on the things that actually matter.
 
The company was founded in 2014 with the goal to create the ultimate stain-resistant t-shirt with an advanced hydrophobic nanotechnology.
 

Since then we have shipped thousands of orders to happy customers all over the world and have expanded our range to a collection of stain-resistant polos, dress shirts and accessories.

Today we're taking that approach to the next level with our newest collection for what we believe are the best base layers for travel.

Snow White Collection

Caviar Black

Our base layer collection is made up of henleys and pocket t-shirts that come in short and long sleeve.

We chose henleys for their added functionality and versatile aesthetic. They are timeless and technical in equal measure and make the perfect foundation piece for any weather or occasion. 

And we elevated a classic t-shirt by adding a seamless pocket for an everyday essential that you can take you anywhere. We also added underarm gussets for ultimate freedom of movement.

They are available in sizes XS - XXXL.

We are launching this Indiegogo campaign to not only raise funds but only to justify the volumes of manufacturing but to also get a wholesale rate that allows us to bring these base layers to you at a better price.

This is the beginning of a series of applying more advanced performance fabrics to everyday essentials in a mission that we believe can change the world.

story:
Short Summary

News Flash:  We need mothers nowadays who have more than a m.i.l.f. status or a six-pack within 6 weeks of giving birth.  We need moms with energy, vitality, and confidence.  We need moms with strength that matters.  The sort of strength that helps them face the insane demands of modern motherhood but that doesn't require a part-time job to attain.

We need moms who feel good in their skin.  Who can outrun chaos.  Who can teach the world acceptance/tolerance/problem solving.  We need moms who know - and feel in their bones - that they are enough.

In the world of fitness programs for moms, Momma Strong is taking a different path.  We're rebellious.  We're intelligent.  We're intensely strengthening.  We are enough.

Momma Strong offers strength that matters in a format that meets mothers exactly where they are.   Daily 15-minute ass-kicking, deeply satisfying workouts designed strategically around a woman's unique physique available in a portable, reliable, online format.  

By joining the Momma Strong movement, you are raising your hand in support of a shift from strength for moms being about merely fitness to it being about how women choose to show up in the world.  And we need women to show up in the world.  With strength.

Founder's Bio:  Courtney Wyckoff, CPT, CES

I am a Certified Personal Trainer and Corrective Exercise Specialist, with 12 years experience in the field of fitness, nutrition, and injury prevention/treatment.  I have been working exclusively with pre- and postnatal women for the last 7 years, which has allowed me the opportunity to see how seldom women in this country get the sort of support and information they need to feel good in their skin during the childbearing years.  Due to this, I have completed specializations in pelvic stabilization, core integration, and resiliency training, all of which I believe gives women their superpowers back after birth.  Additionally, I have worked on creating at-home programs for women that are feasible, sustainable, AND effective.  Which means that I have tried to keep in mind that most mothers just might have to do their exercises with an infant tied to her back and a toddler playing with string beans in his nose while chasing the dogs in circles around the house.

Yet with all the official credentials, I think the most important one is that I am a mother myself.  In fact, I started this movement while 9 months pregnant with my second child.  Along with that, I have suffered from many motherhood-related issues, including Sacroiliac Dysfunction, Sciatica, degenerated discs, facet disease, and rotator cuff impingement.  I’m telling you this because I want you to know that I know what you are going through and I’m not a fake, flake, or a person full of false promises.  Nope, I’m the real deal.  And I care intensely about the physical empowerment of women.

Chief Brand Ambassador's Bio: Barbie Atkinson, M.S., LPC

Barbie comes to Momma Strong as a Licensed Professional Counselor with a dual Master's of Science Degree in Marriage and Family Counseling and MH Counseling.  She has been working extensively in her field for the last 15 years, most recently at Baylor College of Medicine as a Clinical Interventionist.  Within the scope of Momma Strong, Barbie has joined the team as the Chief Brand Ambassador. She serves as protector of the brand and speaker of its mission, helping the outside world appreciate the boundaries of the corporation and the values of the tribe of women who gather here. Additionally, she helps nurture and maintain key partnerships with like-minded organizations that can help fuel Momma Strong's growth.


What We Need & What You Get

Watch this super short (1.5 minute) video to see exactly why we're asking for help and what projects and services we're ready to launch as soon as we can get funding.  



Let's break it down.  Here is full disclosure of all the basics that keep this engine running.  Currently, we've put all the skin in the game that we can and in order to make our voice even louder, we need help that does not compromise the movement's mission/values (through misaligned sponsorships and advertisers, etc).  

Free these basics up for us for a year and you'll witness some magical shizzle growing!

We are offering some ridiculously awesome perks in exchange for your support.  Don't expect the normal stuff from Momma Strong, though.  We're talking weekly jokes delivered while Courtney holds a potty squat; the opportunity to choose a character/costume Courtney has to portray during a workout; having an exercise named after you for all eternity; adventure weekends; and deluxe wellness retreats.


The Impact

Empowered badass confident energetic pain-free showing-up Moms. Period. 

And Courtney's sanity.  Which is also awesome.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate the dollar bills, yo, no worries:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign!
  • Indiegogo has some awesome share tools ... use 'em.

with pre- and postnatal women for the last 7 years, which has allowed me the opportunity to see how seldom women in this country get the sort of support and information they need to feel good in their skin during the childbearing years.  Due to this, I have completed specializations in pelvic stabilization, core integration, and resiliency training, all of which I believe gives women their superpowers back after birth.  Additionally, I have worked on creating at-home programs for women that are feasible, sustainable, AND effective.  Which means that I have tried to keep in mind that most mothers just might have to do their exercises with an infant tied to her back and a toddler playing with string beans in his nose while chasing the dogs in circles around the house.Yet with all the official credentials, I think the most important one is that I am a mother myself.  In fact, I started this movement while 9 months pregnant with my second child.  Along with that, I have suffered from many motherhood-related issues, including Sacroiliac Dysfunction, Sciatica, degenerated discs, facet disease, and rotator cuff impingement.  I’m telling you this because I want you to know that I know what you are going through and I’m not a fake, flake, or a person full of false promises.  Nope, I’m the real deal.  And I care intensely about the physical empowerment of women.Chief Brand Ambassador's Bio: Barbie Atkinson, M.S., LPCBarbie comes to Momma Strong as a Licensed Professional Counselor with a dual Master's of Science Degree in Marriage and Family Counseling and MH Counseling.  She has been working extensively in her field for the last 15 years, most recently at Baylor College of Medicine as a Clinical Interventionist.  Within the scope of Momma Strong, Barbie has joined the team as the Chief Brand Ambassador. She serves as protector of the brand and speaker of its mission, helping the outside world appreciate the boundaries of the corporation and the values of the tribe of women who gather here. Additionally, she helps nurture and maintain key partnerships with like-minded organizations that can help fuel Momma Strong's growth.
What We Need & What You Get
Watch this super short (1.5 minute) video to see exactly why we're asking for help and what projects and services we're ready to launch as soon as we can get funding.  


Let's break it down.  Here is full disclosure of all the basics that keep this engine running.  Currently, we've put all the skin in the game that we can and in order to make our voice even louder, we need help that does not compromise the movement's mission/values (through misaligned sponsorships and advertisers, etc).  
Free these basics up for us for a year and you'll witness some magical shizzle growing!

We are offering some ridiculously awesome perks in exchange for your support.  Don't expect the normal stuff from Momma Strong, though.  We're talking weekly jokes delivered while Courtney holds a potty squat; the opportunity to choose a character/costume Courtney has to portray during a workout; having an exercise named after you for all eternity; adventure weekends; and deluxe wellness retreats.

The Impact
Empowered badass confident energetic pain-free showing-up Moms. Period.  
And Courtney's sanity.  Which is also awesome.

Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't donate the dollar bills, yo, no worries:

Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign! 

Indiegogo has some awesome share tools ... use 'em.

story:
Introduction



The Problem:

Weather protection is one of the biggest industries in the world and one of the most important facets of daily life. It consumes the news and determines what we will wear or bring with us everyday when we leave our home.

We can land a rover on a comet and design an ultra thin smart phone but we are still relying on two antiquated products for our complete weather protection needs -- the umbrella and the raincoat & hood!

Let's face it our current weather protection gear --- just isn't doing the job!

Although the umbrella is most widely known for inverting it is not the biggest problem. The major drawback with the umbrella is; You Have to Hold It!

And for our only current hands-free solution; the raincoat --- well most would agree it is a far cry from an acceptable one. It provides  limited protection at best and doesn't provide any protection for anything you are holding or using; i.e phone, camera etc...

Most everyone can imagine a time they wished they had a true hands-free umbrella whether working or just doing everyday basic activities.


                          Are you tired of this?

                

                                                      

      

             

                                                         Sun protection!



             If so, then you are going to love this!




The Solution!


An Idea is Born!

Several years ago while sitting in a coffee shop in NYC on a miserable rainy windy day I began to take notice of how everyone was struggling with their umbrella. I also noticed the faces of those working who were relying merely on a raincoat. It was at that moment an image appeared in my mind of what an alternative weather  protection device/umbrella should look like. I ran to a desk and sketched it.

                                                                                                Alan Kaufman -- Founder


Introducing Nubrella


"Nubrella is a breakthrough product innovation. It is a Hands-Free, Inversion Proof -- new weather protection device conveniently worn backpack style!"





Nubrella launched it's initial 'bubble" like model which was presented on the hit TV show Shark Tank. But the Shark's were a little too greedy so we didn't end up doing a deal.

Although this design was successfully sold in 82 countries with significant feedback it became very apparent we needed return to the design table.

Customers around the world loved the hands-free but found being fully enclosed in bubble was; overkill protection, did not allow for communication with others, impaired vision and was a bit 'dorky' looking. And we agreed!

So Nubrella was redesigned and we met all of our design goals and more!

Our new model is being hailed as; The Ultimate User-Friendly backpack style worn open-front Hands-Free & Wind-Resistant umbrella design.

Our new design provides protection against; rain, snow, wind and sun! Millions still hold an umbrella to block the sun. Nubrella finally offers these users a hands-free solution as well eliminating the tiresome act of having to hold an umbrella and offers far superior protection over a hat.

Nubrella could be the next "MUST HAVE ITEM" -- added to your current arsenal of weather protection gear and apparel.



                                          

        Final streamlined look of Nubrella (yet clear panel stops at eye level)



How It Works:


Nubrella is designed to be conveniently worn backpack style and simply function like a hood going back and forth when needed.

When not with the simple press of a button the canopy springs back behind you and stores down you back like a hood --  eliminating the need to carry anything!

With Nubrella's patented clever extended aerodynamic canopy wind simply flows over and around the canopy completely denying any ability to invert. We have also designed the canopy to be very stabilized to manage strong winds.

In addition Nubrella has extended out the coverage in the front to cover the use of smart phones and tablets.

 Finally with with extended coverage on the sides and rear it blocks wind chill keeping the user significantly warmer! Nubrella is ideal for a snowstorm -- go ahead and shovel or walk and be completely protected...



Where & When?

Yet to fully understand Nubrella and its value propositions it is designed for those who have to be outdoors for extended periods of time  whether working or just doing everyday basic activities. It is not designed to replace your traditional umbrella to run tot the car or other very simple uses......

With this said with feedback from the customer and our own study we have identified over 100 applications/usages in the commercial and recreational fields.

Here are just a few;

Recreational:

  1. Riding a bike/scooter to work or school
  2. Standing at a Parade(Macy's), speech/rally, in a long line (Apple store)
  3. Walking the dog(s)
  4. Tailgating at major sporting event (NASCAR, NCAA, MLS, NFL etc..)
  5. Using a wheelchair/crutches/scooter/ Segway
  6. Hiking, fishing, hunting, walking for exercise
  7. Pushing the stroller, soccer mom who wants to text and drink coffee
  8. Commuters waiting for bus or train
  9. Shoveling snow
  10. Sun protection

Commercial:

  1. Delivering the mail, crossing guard, meter maid(ticket)
  2. Professional photographer
  3. TV Cameraman
  4. Security Personnel
  5. At Disney or other theme park
  6. Construction workers
  7. Surveyors
  8. Scientist/Biologist/Geologist
  9. Agricultural workers/landscaping
  10. Airport ground crew
  11. News, Sports & Weather reporters



Sizes & Color

Nubrella will launch with a one size fits all. Nubrella can be adjusted with the straps for a comfort fit. adjustable with the backpack straps so it should fit most all. Nubrella plans several other sizes in the near future, i.e children, extra large...

Initially Nubrella will have a UV sun reflective black waterproof material. Yet, as seen in  the illustration Nubrella will have one clear panel in front for perfect vision and the sides clear for excellent peripheral vision.

With a minimum quantity order Nubrella can be made of any color. design or logo/branding; i.e. camouflage, Nike, pink etc....




Is this Revolutionary?

Well, we will leave that up to you, but we certainly think so! Why? Because we are delivering a solution to a huge unmet need in the market.

Everyone can imagine a time they wished they had a  real Hands-Free umbrella.


The Timing couldn't be better!

We now live in a technological society where everyone is completely dependent upon smart phones and tablets  both in the workplace and recreationally. More than ever we need our hands-free and our devices protected! 

With Nubrella go ahead and use your I-Pad as a Terminix employee. Or watch your child play soccer while taking a video or drinking your coffee and talk, or walk to school or work and text away....


Nubrella is poised to change weather protection forever.

Finally people will have an alternative product to turn to that offers far superior protection over the raincoat and relives those tired arms from having to hold up an umbrella.

Major News: 

Nubrella is extremely proud to announce we have just been granted a Utility Patent in the US and have filed our PCT applications providing international protection.


This is a significant milestone for the company.

Nubrella now owns the only patent in the world for a true 'wearable' Hands-Free umbrella! 


Other Models/Accessories:


Nubrella-Pack

For those who require a backpack with their Nubrella, we have designed a custom Nubrella backpack in the rear. Once you get where your going --- snap it off and you have a full standard backpack.

Why Our backpack?

Due to Nubrella's extensive engineering for stability and fit to add a backpack it needed certain weight and size dimensions to attach to Nubrella. So your own backpack simply won't work.

Yet, we will be offering our backpack as an accessory at a considerable discount vs. the same backpack you would purchase in a store.



                                     (simulation may vary in size and color)


Nubrella Sport: Coming soon

A streamlined version for use inside sport stadiums around the world. Nubrella will be working with the NFL, NASCAR, World Soccer Federation and the NCAA to get approved for use inside the stadium and have your favorite team logo or driver on the rear.



Also Coming soon -- Nubrella Kids

Parents will love Nubrella kids. There are no sharp points or rods that can be considered dangerous. Also because it is worn much less chance of them losing it.

Finally coming soon - Nubrella Mobile

We will be adding Bluetooth wireless technology so you can communicate or listen to music completely Hands-Free as well.

                           We ask; "what would you rather do?"




USE OF PROCEEDS

Your contribution will allow us to complete the tooling process - approximately 60 days. Once completed samples will be approved and we will be ready for immediate manufacturing. 

We plan to have Nubrellas in your hands (or should we say no hands needed) in early 2015 March-April. 

We already have many prepaid customers waiting and many others on a list to be contacted once our new design is ready. The retail price for Nubrella will be $99.99. I can assure it it is worth it and we will guarantee it for life!

We also have many Fortune 1000 companies, international resellers, the largest on-line retailers, mass retailers and major media all waiting release and samples. 



It's been a long road

I personally have invested hundreds of thousand of dollars along with some friends and family to bring Nubrella to where it is today.

In addition I have dedicated and sacrificed 11 years of my life committed to bringing change to this overlooked industry.

Many said it couldn't be done and only companies can bring such innovation to market. Well I have turned the non-believers into believers.

I now just need a little help from you to get Nubrella's new design over the finish line and take the world by storm!

Weather protection is ripe for innovation. This industry has remained overlooked far too long.

With a pledge you can be part of the Nubrella story.

In return for your gracious support we are going to offer you the ability to purchase one or more now at a considerable discount ($49 down from $99.99 - a 50% savings)

With your purchase you will be guaranteed to get one first from our initial production run even though we are already oversold with other sign ups. So you will be the envy of all your friends, family and the unknown...



We've Done This Before

Nubrella launched it's initial 'bubble' like design several years ago. We have worked with the leading product design & engineering firms in the country, developed full set of CAD and 2D drawings, completed tooling, patented, sourced manufacturing partners, fulfillment partner, built an e-commerce website and shipped to 82 countries.

So Nubrella 2.0 will only be easier. We have learned a lot from launching our first design. We know what to look out for, how to properly plan, execute and deliver a very high quality product.



Risks & Challenges

There are always risks and Nubrella has risks as well.

Yet, we are confident the risk levels are quite low. This is mainly due because all the hard work is done and Nubrella is ready fro immediate tooling and manufacturing.

Most all risk is tied to timing. We have to approve tooling and can not control how busy our manufacturing partner may be at the time of our orders. Yet with current relationships we will receive priority and have a representative in China to help insure the entire process.


Other Ways You Can Help
If you are unable to make a pledge just spreading the word will be extremely helpful. Given the amount of usages for our hands-free umbrella designs everyone is a potential customer.

So just using your social networks to tell all your friends about Nubrella can help us as well.

As the Founder I personally want to thank you for viewing this presentation and of course for any pledge you make.


My dream is just around the corner where I will see Nubrellas enhancing peoples lives whether working or just doing everyday basic activities.

I have a special milestone I want to reach. With help from corporate America I hope to be able to donate many Nubrellas at the Walter Reed medical center to our wounded heroes who are confined to a wheelchair, blind or other where Nubrella will make their life just a bit easier.

Thank you in advance,

Alan Kaufman - Founder & CEO

story:
Le Cercle des Parfumeurs Créateurs, c’est l’histoire de parfumeurs français, nez anonymes à l’origine de créations célèbres de la parfumerie actuelle, qui ont pu créer leur parfum idéal, sans direction marketing ni contrainte économique.

Les parfumeurs passent ainsi de l’ombre à la lumière, et signent fièrement leurs créations. Le résultat : des eaux de parfum magnifiques et inédites.


Six parfumeurs ont déjà rejoint Le Cercle des Parfumeurs Créateurs


Nathalie Feisthauer

Sa création pour Le Cercle des Parfumeurs Créateurs :

A l’Iris

Ses créations précédentes :

  • Eau des Merveilles  - Hermès
  • Hugo Element - Hugo Boss
  • Must for men - Cartier


Antoine Lie

Sa création pour Le Cercle des Parfumeurs Créateurs :

Vague de Folie Verte

Ses créations précédentes :

  • Armani Code - Giorgio Armani
  • Romance for men - Ralph Lauren
  • Parfum d'été - Kenzo


Cécile Matton

Sa création pour Le Cercle des Parfumeurs Créateurs :

L’eau à la bouche

Ses créations précédentes :

  • Baby Doll - Yves Saint Laurent
  • Elle l'aime - Lolita Lempicka
  • Valentino Gold - Valentino


Julie Massé

Sa création pour Le Cercle des Parfumeurs Créateurs :

La Dame Blanche

Ses créations précédentes :

  • Terracotta Eau sous le vent - Guerlain
  • Blanc de Courrèges - Courrèges
  • Noble leather - Yves Saint Laurent


Amélie Bourgeois

Sa création pour Le Cercle des Parfumeurs Créateurs :

Magnol’Art

Ses créations précédentes :

  • Rouge Assassin - Jovoy
  • Paradis Perdu - Frapin


Karine Chevallier

Sa création pour Le Cercle des Parfumeurs Créateurs :

Lime Absolue

Ses créations précédentes :

  • Oranger en fleurs - L’Artisan Parfumeur
  • The Body Collection - Patyka


Le Cercle des Parfumeurs Créateurs accueille un nouveau membre

Jean-Christophe Hérault

Jean-Christophe a grandi dans les coulisses de la fabrication de parfums, son père produisant des concentrés de parfums. Adolescent, ce dernier lui offre Joop for Men. « C'était la première fois que je tombais amoureux d’un parfum. » se souvient Jean-Christophe.

Durant ses études de chimie, il effectue un stage à Grasse au cours duquel il est fasciné par les champs de mimosa et par les absolues de jasmin et de tubéreuse.

Formé par Pierre Bourdon, le créateur de Joop for Men  et lui-même élève d'Edmond Roudnitska (le créateur d'Eau Sauvage de Dior), Jean-Christophe développe rapidement son propre langage olfactif et prend en notes ce que chaque matière première évoque en lui.

Convaincu que l’audace et la créativité sont les clés de la parfumerie de demain, Jean-Christophe Héraut s’efforce d’imaginer des parfums qui réveillent en chacun de fortes émotions.

Ses créations précédentes :

  • Florabotanica - Balenciaga
  • Rosabotanica - Balenciaga
  • Karl Lagerfeld for Him - Karl Lagerfeld
  • Amazingreen - Comme des Garçons


Sa création pour Le Cercle des Parfumeurs Créateurs : Osmanthée

Osmanthus Fragrans, appelé aussi Olivier de Chine

"J’ai toujours voulu créer une fragrance autour de l’osmanthus.

C'est une fleur très intéressante, à la fois délicate et fraîche.

On y devine le parfum doux et propre d’un abricot juteux et de la fleur de jasmin, ainsi que des facettes légèrement cuirées et théinées.

Je voudrais exprimer dans ce parfum la délicatesse et la légèreté de la fleur tout en soulignant son caractère chaleureux et sensuel."

Avec votre soutien, Le Cercle des Parfumeurs Créateurs rendra accessible à tous cette magnifique création de Jean-Christophe Hérault. 


Comment participer ?

  • En partageant avec vos amis notre projet (cliquez sur les icones en bas de page)
  • En rejoignant notre communauté Facebook : https://www.facebook.com/LeCercleDesParfumeursCreateurs
  • En nous soutenant avec un don
  • En précommandant Osmanthée
  • En commandant la collection des parfums du Cercle des Parfumeurs Créateurs
  • En participant à la Master Class de Jean-Christophe Hérault spéciale Osmanthée à Paris
story_txt:
Le Cercle des Parfumeurs
Créateurs, c’est l’histoire de parfumeurs français, nez anonymes à l’origine
de créations célèbres de la parfumerie actuelle, qui ont pu créer leur parfum
idéal, sans direction marketing ni contrainte économique.
Les parfumeurs passent ainsi de l’ombre à la lumière, et
signent fièrement leurs créations. Le résultat : des eaux de parfum magnifiques et inédites.



Six parfumeurs ont déjà rejoint Le Cercle des Parfumeurs Créateurs






Nathalie Feisthauer




Sa création pour Le Cercle des Parfumeurs Créateurs :
A l’Iris
Ses créations précédentes :


Eau des Merveilles  - Hermès 


Hugo Element - Hugo Boss 


Must for men - Cartier 







Antoine Lie 




Sa création pour Le Cercle des Parfumeurs Créateurs :
Vague de Folie Verte
Ses créations précédentes :


Armani Code - Giorgio Armani 


Romance for men - Ralph Lauren 


Parfum d'été - Kenzo







Cécile Matton 




Sa création pour Le Cercle des Parfumeurs Créateurs :
L’eau à la bouche
Ses créations précédentes :


Baby Doll -  Yves Saint Laurent 


Elle l'aime - Lolita Lempicka 


Valentino Gold - Valentino 







Julie Massé 




Sa création pour Le Cercle des Parfumeurs Créateurs :
La Dame Blanche
Ses créations précédentes :


Terracotta Eau sous le vent - Guerlain 


Blanc de Courrèges - Courrèges 


Noble leather - Yves Saint Laurent







Amélie Bourgeois 




Sa création pour Le Cercle des Parfumeurs Créateurs : 
Magnol’Art
Ses créations précédentes :


Rouge Assassin - Jovoy 


Paradis Perdu - Frapin 







Karine Chevallier 




Sa création pour Le Cercle des Parfumeurs Créateurs :
Lime Absolue
Ses créations précédentes :


Oranger en fleurs - L’Artisan Parfumeur 


The Body Collection - Patyka 






Le Cercle des Parfumeurs Créateurs  accueille un nouveau membre


Jean-Christophe Hérault

Jean-Christophe a grandi dans les coulisses de la fabrication de parfums, son père produisant des concentrés de parfums. Adolescent, ce dernier lui offre Joop for Men. « C'était la première fois que
je tombais amoureux d’un parfum. » se souvient Jean-Christophe.
Durant ses études de chimie, il effectue un stage à Grasse au cours duquel il est fasciné par les champs de mimosa et par les absolues de jasmin et de tubéreuse.
Formé par Pierre Bourdon, le créateur de Joop for Men  et lui-même élève d'Edmond Roudnitska (le créateur d'Eau Sauvage de Dior), Jean-Christophe développe rapidement son propre langage olfactif et prend en notes ce que chaque matière première évoque en lui.
Convaincu que l’audace et la créativité sont les clés de la parfumerie de demain, Jean-Christophe Héraut s’efforce d’imaginer des parfums qui réveillent en
chacun de fortes émotions.
Ses créations précédentes :


Florabotanica - Balenciaga 


Rosabotanica - Balenciaga 


Karl Lagerfeld for Him - Karl Lagerfeld 


Amazingreen - Comme des Garçons  



Sa création pour Le Cercle des Parfumeurs Créateurs : Osmanthée 



Osmanthus Fragrans, appelé aussi Olivier de Chine

"J’ai toujours voulu créer une fragrance autour de l’osmanthus. 
C'est une fleur très intéressante, à la fois délicate et fraîche. 
On y devine le parfum doux et propre d’un abricot juteux et de la fleur de jasmin, ainsi que des facettes légèrement cuirées et théinées.
Je voudrais exprimer dans ce parfum la délicatesse et la légèreté de la fleur tout en soulignant son caractère chaleureux et sensuel." 

Avec votre soutien, Le Cercle des Parfumeurs Créateurs
rendra accessible à tous cette magnifique création de Jean-Christophe
Hérault. 


Comment participer ?




En partageant avec vos amis notre projet (cliquez sur les icones en bas de page)

En rejoignant notre communauté Facebook : https://www.facebook.com/LeCercleDesParfumeursCreateurs

En nous soutenant avec un don

En précommandant Osmanthée

En commandant la collection des parfums du Cercle des Parfumeurs Créateurs

En participant à la Master Class de Jean-Christophe Hérault spéciale Osmanthée  à Paris

story:
Ladies! Your hair can look great anytime & Anywhere with the Easy to-use-MiniSleek


Hi my name is Marlene I'm a professional hairstylist. I'm excited to introduce to you a portable wireless flatiron. I came across this idea when I was working on my hair and thought about how inconvenient it would be to take the flatiron with me and to travel with it.
I call it MiniSleek. MiniSleek is a cordless flatiron that is small enough to fit in your purse so that you can use it for touch ups throughout the day when you are on the go.  Unlike other options on the market this one is battery operated, so no bulky cords or bases to worry about. 
Currently I’m working with a manufacturing and design firm to make this product come to life.  I already have all of the components defined but I’m asking for your support to raise the money required for full product design and the first production run of 1000 units, making this product available for everyone to use.


What We Need & What You Get

Currently We have a patent pending and we need to raise $ 50000 to complete the first production run. The money raised will allow us to finish the first prototype and manufacture the first 1000 units. I'm excited to bring this product to the market because of its truly unique portable features. I designed the Minisleek to be compact for maximum convenience when traveling even overseas; you don't  have to worry about electricity conversion while traveling abroad. The Minisleek is easy to carry in your purse making it simple to touch up your hair while you're on the road.


 




While the traditional flatiron can smooth your hair but do not come with all the convenience of the cordless flatiron. Here are some points of why this product is different from the traditional flatiron in the market.
    

  • Light weight 

  • Straighten and curl

  • Even heat smooth glide

  • Battery operated that lasts 30- 40 minutes

  • You can take it with you to use throughout the day for touch ups

  • Great for travel don't have to worry about electricity conversion

  • No hassle with messy wires that get in your way

  • Comes with heat resistant box cover so you don't have to wait till the flatiron cools.

  • High quality titanium plates heat up faster making your hair silky, smooth, shiny and frizz free while your on the go to your next event or destination 


Other Ways You Can Help


Please help share this video with all your friends and family.


I wanted to take the time to thank everyone that helped me with this project. I would like to thank my client, family, friends, and everyone that contribute and shared this video. I also wanted thank my videographers at SceneWork.US and Casey Durkin actress. Wanted to thank my sister Evelyn David, Vivian Abraham, Ellen Mulvanny, Anna Abramovich. Very spacial thank you to Cameron Clarke for helping me with this project.
Thank you for watching we appreciate all your contribution and support!

story:
Hello! And thank you so much for stopping by!

My name is Nick Evers, and I am on a quest to achieve a major career highlight. I am trying to bring my vision to Brooklyn Fashion Week. 

This campaign is to help fund what it will cost for me to achieve this goal. 

First, a little bit about myself. Born and raised in Florida, my mother encouraged my budding passion for the arts. She also allowed me to play with toys not typically seen in the hands of boys...namely, Barbie dolls. Little did she know that both of those things would spark a lifelong passion for fashion design.

My epiphany came when, in the late 90s, Bob Mackie came out with a line of dolls that were so beautifully clothed and beaded, that it became clear to me that there was something especially wonderful about the art of designing clothes. It was then that a sketch pad and some pencils were never too far from my grasp. 

Flash forward to my especially wild and experimental fashion days in high school, I began to seriously look into fashion schools. A summer program suggestion came from my psychology professor, and I began my experience at Savannah College of Art and Design, where I would eventually attain a Bachelor of Fine Arts in fashion design, specializing in menswear, and a minor in accessory design. 

I would go on to have work featured in a window display at Saks Fifth Avenue in Atlanta, GA, 3 fashion shows and lots of freelance work. 

CLICK HERE TO SEE MY FIRST FASHION SHOW OUTSIDE OF SCHOOL!

Now I live in the Bronx, NY. One might say I've made it, I'm a designer in New York. But, I won't be satisfied with "just making it." I want to push myself. I want to continue to bring myself to the next level. 

That is exactly why this campaign is so important to me. This event, which I am so thankful I am able to participate in, will do just that. It will help to bring my vision front and center to the people of New York. 

My Goals

As many will attest, getting a fashion collection together is neither easy, nor cheap. While I am very good with stretching dollars, for this, I need a little assistance. 

My financial goal for this campaign is $3,500, which will cover most of the following:

  • Designer fee for Brooklyn Fashion Week
  • Full body male dress form
  • Machines
  • Fabrics, trims and materials
  • Photographer
  • Videographer
  • Promotional materials

So what's in it for you? Awesome, one-of-a-kind handbags, clothes and other items!

For an idea of what I've made in the past and what you may expect to see as part of your incentive, you can visit my website at:

www.nickevers.com

For "The Ultimate Experience" and "VIP Experience" levels, this is where you can experience what it's like to have a tote/messenger or garment made just for you! Designed just the way you want it, with colors, pockets and trims all up to you. As the designer, I will help guide you to your ideal bag/garment if you're unsure of where to start. 

If the full $3,500 isn't reached, the money that is raised will be carefully assessed, and put towards what I can afford. 

Why This Campaign?

There may be some who see fashion as frivolous. Something that is not of great importance. 

I am not one of those people. 

To me, fashion is a living, breathing art that everyone on this planet participates in everyday. It's a message of who we are, what we're doing, where we're going. It's the ultimate form of self expression. 

It is my greatest passion. I am a very hard working, creative designer, who would love the opportunity to push the commitment to his craft further.

In supporting this campaign, you are not only supporting the arts and creativity, but you are also helping me to achieve my dreams. And anything you can contribute to that, my gratitude will be never ending.

What Else Can I Do?

If you cannot contribute, I can totally understand! If you still want to help me in my journey, share, tweet and post this campaign for all to see. Use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you so much for your attention, and I hope to see you from the runway in October!

story:
ELECTRIFY YOURSELF WITH ELEKSTICK UKULELES.

We love music. We love ukuleles. We love minimalism. We love wood. We love metallic chrome.

Plug in and Play.

 

YOUR SUPPORT. YOUR BENEFIT.

By participating and supporting this campaign, you become a founding parent of a cool, respectable, socially responsible North American ukulele brand.

Your name is recorded as a founding funder and becomes a proud part of our history. (Yet, you can choose to be anonymous.)

Your perk (a limited edition Elekstick ukulele) is a future collectors’ item.

 

OUR GOAL IS TO BUILD A RESPECTABLE UKULELE BRAND.

www.aichibimusic.com

We are serious believers of a quote from Jake Shimabukuro, one of the greatest ukulele players in the world. He once said, “If everyone played the ukulele, the world would have been a much happier place.”

Our goal is to become a reputable ukulele manufacturer. Our company is based in Toronto, Canada. All our AICHIBI ukuleles, including Elekstick ukuleles, are manufactured in Canada.

If you support us through this indiegogo campaign, your name will be recorded and displayed as a founding funder of AICHIBI on our website. You become a proud part of our history. (However, for any reason, if you do not want your name to appear, we will respect that, too.)

If you are supporting with $140 and up, you will receive one of the first batch of Elekstick ukuleles. “Indiegogo Campaign Limited Edition” will be engraved on your Elekstick ukulele. Imagine. Once we become a reputable ukulele brand, your Elekstick ukulele becomes a collectors’ item. This is a good investment.

PROJECTION OF LASER ENGRAVED “INDIEGOGO CAMPAIGN LIMITED EDITION” (It will actually look better than this.)

PROJECTION OF THE CERTIFICATE OF APPRECIATION (It will actually look much better than this.)

 

FEATURES

Minimalistic Tenor Electric Ukulele Design

Solid Hardwood Bodies (Hard Maple, White Oak, Black Walnut or Bubinga)

Genuine Aquila Nylgut Strings

Piezo Pickup System

Volume and Tone Controls

Indian Rosewood Fingerboard and Bridge

Ox Bone Nut and Saddle

Natural Oil Matte Finish

 

WE BELIEVE IN SOCIAL RESPONSIBILITY OF BUSINESSES.

We will be donating our ukuleles to children’s hospitals so that these hospitals can use our ukuleles in their music therapy or as discharge gifts.

You can also participate by supporting us with $180 and more (details in funder’s options). For each Elekstick ukulele you fund through “Good Bird Specials” or “Angel Bird Specials”, we will donate one uke-kid ukulele ($40 retail value; Basswood model).

We also have a plan to support ukulele teachers/tutors, especially ukulele educators teaching at senior residents or public schools. For this matter, please contact us at info@aichibimusic.com.

 

LET US COLLABORATE FOR MUTUALLY BENEFICIAL RELATIONSHIPS.

Are you a youtube star musician? Let’s talk about collaboration! We would love to collaborate with young or new musicians gaining popularity on the net (e.g. Youtube stars), and eventually hope to sponsor them in the future. One good example is our crowdfunding campaign video created by Brand New Style and Stephanie Lauren Choi.

For more information, please visit www.youtube.com/user/OfficialBNSTV & www.youtube.com/user/stephaniechoimusic and enjoy their music.

Do you have a great design sense or inspiration, and want to make some changes to the appearance of our Elekstick ukulele? Yeah, sure. Why not? Simply contact us, and let’s talk about it. You may be able to receive a loyalty from our new designer edition based on your suggestion.

For above cases, contact us at info@aichibimusic.com please.

 

SCHEDULE

July & Early August – Indiegogo Crowdfunding Campaign

Late August & September – Preproduction Period (Machines and Tools Setup, Inventory Stock-up)

October – Production Start and Delivery to Funders

The campaign fund will be used for setting up and completing the manufacturing processes, especially for laser engraver and CNC plasma cutter.

 

FAQ?

  1. Is it an electric ukulele? – Yes, it is. You will need a guitar amplifier for maximum sound performance.
  2. Do I need batteries for this? – Not at all. You do not need batteries. It is same as an electric guitar.
  3. What makes this limited edition so special? – We will laser engrave “Indiegogo Campaign Limited Edition” on your ukulele. This limited edition will not be available for sale after this funding campaign.
  4. I am left-handed. Do you make left-handed models? – Of course yes. Simply indicate that you want it to be left-handed when you support us. We do not make only right-handed ones. We make one that is right for you. :)
  5. I forgot to add a shipping fee. – No need to worry. You can contribute the additional shipping fee and update us via email (info@aichibimusic.com). Please do not forget to leave us your name and your perk selection for accurate matching.
  6. I live outside North America. I do not know how much I have to add for a shipping fee. – We have made a list of shipping fees to various countries outside North America. Please read through the list. If your country is not on the current list, please please email us (info@aichibimusic.com). We will add the shipping fee for your country and notify you via email.

RAQ (rarely asked questions)? – Disclaimer: This is meant for entertainment purpose only.

  1. Can I practice Kendo with this elekstick ukulele? – Although it is made of hardwood and resembles a stick, please do not try to hit anybody with it. Ukuleles are for peace.
  2. I can use both hands for playing. Which one (right-handed or left-handed) should I buy? – Play rock-paper-scissor with your both hands. Get the one for the hand that wins first three times. That is scientifically called your “dominant” hand.
  3. Would I get a girlfriend if I play this awesome elekstick ukulele? – You will definitely look awesome with our elekstick ukulele. But to get a girlfriend? No, not enough. You not only need to play it yourself, but also have to buy one for her. So buy two. :)

 

STILL MORE QUESTIONS OR CONCERNS?

Please visit our website – www.aichibimusic.com

Or email us directly – info@aichibimusic.com

Or contact us through our social media pages

Facebook – https://www.facebook.com/pages/Aichibi-Music/280054372138635

Twitter – https://twitter.com/AICHIBIMUSIC

Google Plus – https://plus.google.com/115873927926517715839/posts

Pinterest – http://pinterest.com/aichibimusic

Youtube – http://www.youtube.com/user/AICHIBIMUSIC

Soundcloud – https://soundcloud.com/aichibi-music

Tumblr – http://aichibimusic.tumblr.com/

story:
*To see pictures of our lovely rewards scroll down the page.


THE VISION:

The ONE LOVE DESIGN HOUSE is a collective formed by Rachel Gordon, Jen Bonoma, Heather Johnson, and Camela Guevara.  Together, these four women are creating a home to showcase sustainable fashion and accessories.  The ONE LOVE DESIGN HOUSE will consist of a custom bridal boutique, featuring wedding gowns designed by Rachel Gordon handmade jewelry by Jen Bonoma and other talented crafts people.  Right next to the bridal design studio and bridal showroom will be the Charleston Garment Manufactory.  CGM will provide on-site clothing production for custom and made-to-measure garments.  CGM will be working for the local designer trade to complete a local supply chain for sustainable fashion designers.  CGM will also be opening a "haberdashery" of sorts.  Individuals will be able to come and explore a beautifully curated retail space to find hand crafted apparel, jewelry, and gifts.  

The ONE LOVE DESIGN HOUSE aims to change the way fashion is discovered, inspired, and consumed in Charleston, SC through strengthening the roots of our community and being a platform for local designers to create, collaborate, and motivate. 

To learn more about the ONE LOVE DESIGN HOUSE:

visit onelovedeisgnhouse.com

Participating Designers Include:

  • ONE LOVE DESIGN by Rachel Gordon 
  • ANGELA HALL DESIGNS
  • BIRDSONG by Jen Bonoma
  • CACTUS FACTORY
  • FOREST AND FIN
  • FOURTH AVENUE GARDENS
  • FRESH STITCH
  • GREGG LAMBTON CARR PHOTOGRAPHY
  • HANNAH GOFF
  • JANETICS INK
  • OLD WHALING CO.
  • ONAWA DESIGNS by Jessica Bauman
  • REWINED CANDLES
  • RIA GRACE
  • ROYAL PEASANTRY
  • SIMPLY BECOMING DESIGNS
  • SOCK MONSTER POSSE
  • STATE by Adrienne Antonson
  • SUITE 33
  • TREATS FOR TRESSES


THE FUNDS:

To accomplish this community-driven effort, money needs to be raised in order to fund infrastructure improvements, equipment for a production facility, and to physically relocate the Charleston Garment Manufactory to the King Street location.  

Money raised will be used to:

- Train employees

- Purchase equipment and software

- Outfit space to be an efficient working facility

- New fixtures to create a inspiring, beautiful place to shop

- Renovations

- CGM's move to the king street location

- All-Encompassing Website to feature all artists carried in the store 




LOVELY REWARDS:

Hand dyed infinity scarf - $40.00 contribution


Charm necklace - $50.00 contribution


Prayer Box Necklace - $45.00 contribution


Hand Stitched Leather Flask - $100 contribution


Women's Organic Cotton T-shirt - $25 contribution


Men's Organic Cotton Army Green T-shirt - $25 Contribution


Women's Organic Cotton White Burnout T-shirt - $35 contribution


Organic Cotton Hoodie - $60 contribution
